item.title: Insurance Agent Owner - Protege Program
item.dc:creator: Envato
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Visit our Website Are you ready for a career in Tulsa with well-rewarded challenges?Do you want to own your own business but do not have the capital to do so right now? Then Farmers may be right for you. Learn how to own and operate an insurance practice from the inside while being paid. We have a new program designed for recent college grads or insurance agency producers that will teach you how to successful run a Farmers Insurance and Financial Services business. This hands on paid position is perfect for someone wanting to know what a typical day is like in the business, and has the desire to run a business. Full training is provided, from marketing, sales, customer service and insurance knowledge. The characteristics we look for in candidates include:
  • High Levels of Energy and Motivation
  • Self-Discipline and Self-Ignited Initiative
  • Honest and Ethical Conduct
  • ExcellentCommunication Skills - both written andverbal
  • Persuasiveness
  • Proven Financial Responsibility
  • Entrepreneurial Ambitions
If you think you have what it takes and you want to transform yourself into a career-oriented professional in a challenging industry that offers unrivaled rewards for your accomplishments, then there is a very good chance that this is the right profession for you! Explore an exciting new opportunity as a Farmers agent!

Job Requirements

  • College Degree (preferred)
  • Some Sales/Management Experience
  • Goal Oriented and Self Motivated
  • Clean driving record
  • Nomajor debts in collections
  • No bankruptcies inlast1 year(s)
  • No felony or criminal convictions
  • Bi-lingual candidates are strongly encouraged to apply

DONT WAIT ANY LONGER.To find out more about beginning a career in the agent protege Farmers program simply apply to this posting via CareerBuilder or better yet, contact me, Steve Worden, directly at [Click Here to Email Your Resum] or 918-388-3933 to set up an appointment. Looking forward to hearing from you.

Visit our Website

item.title: Construction Project Coordinator
item.dc:creator: YouTube
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Find your ideal career with us! Express Employment Professionals is a leading staffing provider and recruiting firm. We are seeking a CONSTRUCTION PROJECT COORDINATOR with a desire in finding long-term employment opportunities with a company that is known for its great benefits and long tenured staff. The Construction Project Coordinator is an integral member of the project team! Responsibilities include:
  • All administrative functions and paperwork surrounding projects ("the right-hand person" to assist technicians in the field).
  • Coordinating the scheduling of installation projects of varying size and complexity.
  • Directing, organizing and controlling project activities, under the direction of a Project Manager (PM).
  • Attend client meetings and assist with determination of project requirements.
  • Track the progress and quality of work being performed by design disciplines (architects, contractors, etc.).
  • Use project scheduling and control tools to monitor projects plans, work hours, budgets and expenditures.
  • Effectively and accurately communicate relevant project information to the client and project team.
  • Ensure clients needs are met in a timely and cost effective manner.
  • Occasional visit to job site
  • Prepare substantial completion certificates and ensure all required project close out documents are obtained
  • Communicate ideas for improving company processes with a positive and constructive attitude.

Job Requirements

Qualifications:
  • Degree or Diploma in Project/Construction Management,Architectural Sciences, or Civil Engineering.
  • 3-5 years of experience supporting Project Managers in the delivery of development projects.
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Outlook Email, Calendar Management).
  • Familiarity with construction methods.
  • Effective communication skills including verbal, written and presentation skills.
  • Proven ability to work effectively both independently and in a team based environment.
  • Demonstrated willingness to be flexible and adaptable to changing priorities.
  • Strong multi-tasking skills.
  • Impeccable organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Strong Customer Service Skills.
  • Ability to work effectively with a variety of personalities and skill sets.
Hours for Project Coordinator:
  • 1st Shift: 8:00 a.m. - 5:00 p.m. Monday through Friday

item.title: Digital / Online Marketing Manager
item.dc:creator: Envato
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

SARA Companion HomeCare Services is now seeking a full-time, Digital/ Online Marketing Manager. The Online Marketing Manager oversees and maintains SARA's web site (including redesign, implementation of new web tools, content management, and search engine optimization, its e-mail marketing efforts, its social media accounts, and all related accounts, including web site analytic, search advertising, and domain name registration.
SARA Companion HomeCare Services is a N.Y. State licensed, bonded & insured home healthcare services agency located in Valley Stream, NY. SARA Companions employs the top licensed professionals and the best paraprofessionals to care for seniors living at home. We have a dedicated inside support staff of caring professionals. We are proud to have the highest percentage and greatest number of positive consumer reviews of any home care agency in the New York Metropolitan area. We are rated A+ with the BBB.

Job Requirements

  • B.A. or B.S. required in Marketing or related field
  • Demonstrated experience using Social Media Channels to implement campaigns that support business goals
  • 57 years relevant experience with e-marketing and content management systems highly desired
  • Knowledge of SharePoint a plus
  • Demonstrated experience with online marketing campaigns, web site management, and strategy development
  • Experience using Photoshop and/or another graphics or related program highly desired
  • Experience with email marketing and innovative online marketing technologies is a MUST!!!
  • Strong writing and editing skills
  • Knowledge of search engine optimization; experience optimizing web sites for search engines
  • Experience implementing online advertising campaigns;
  • Knowledgeable with TV program advertising desired
  • Seeking someone who pays close attention to details and check their work thoroughly.

item.title: Senior Electrical Estimator - Data Center Construction
item.dc:creator: DHL
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

his opportunity is a leading provider of mission-critical data center construction solutions. This firm provides a complete life cycle of solutions that are custom-fit to the requirements of their client's mission-critical facilities. They build mission-criticaldata centerfacilities as well as labs and clean rooms forcompanies nationwide! Senior Electrical Estimator - NYC Solid experience in Electrical Power Distribution and Generation Estimating for Construction Projects a MUST! Responsibilities:
  • Prepare and review Price and Cost Proposals / Specifications, drawings or customer requests to determine equipment requirements.
  • Prepare and review the scope specified within the proposal to ensure it includes appropriate scope
  • Prepare price work up sheets to accurately determine costs and profits
  • Review the labor rates to ensure accordance to the contract specifications and check labor productivity to ensure hours allotted are appropriate to minimize working restrictions, overtime, etc.
  • Prepare and review the material pricing and validate against other pricing references, acquire material quotes when possible
  • Prepare and review pre-purchased material or equipment and/or equipment rental rates against fair and reasonable pricing references
  • Review contractor mark-ups to ensure that the correct mark-ups are being used and that any mark-up caps are not exceeded
  • Assist with the Preparation of Sales Proposals
  • Assist in sales strategy for proposals
  • Interface with Project Managers regarding project requirements
  • Will participate in the negotiation meeting with subcontractors
  • Develop cost estimates from the engineering drawings; proactively identify deficiencies and/or questions; and actively assist the project team toward the answers
  • Prepare and review material take-offs from contract documents and drawings
  • Prepare conceptual and cost study estimates from preliminary sketches
  • Accumulate, evaluate and document historical cost data for the development of future estimates
Submittal Instructions Qualified candidates can send their resume to[Click Here to Email Your Resum]( resume at pkaza dot com ) with 9379489in the subject. After applying, if you have further questions, you may call 973-895-5200 and ask for Iggy. You can also submit via our career portal and also see all of our critical facility openings at:http://jobs.pkaza.com If this job is not for you, feel free to forward this along. WE PAY FOR REFERRALS!! Company offers a competitive compensation and benefits package, medical insurance, a 401(k) plan.EEO/AA Employer M/F/D/V

Job Requirements

Qualifications:
  • Experience with Construction Services for Large Buildings / Facilities a Must
  • Electrical / Mechanical Systems background - preferably experience estimating for UPS, switchgear, PDU, generator, and other critical power systems
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Capable of Multi-tasking in a fast paced environment.
  • MS Office Skills to include: Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, Visio
  • Bachelor's Degree in Business, Finance, Engineering or Construction
  • 5-15+years of experience in performing Cost Estimates, Reviewing Contractor's Price and Cost Proposals for major engineering and construction projects
  • Heavy Construction Projects experience is preferred
  • Experience with Construction Estimation Software (Timberline, Accubid, CMIC, etc)

item.title: Business Development Supervisor - Great Pay!
item.dc:creator: DHL
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

We are looking for people with great people skills and that have an excitement to begin their careers for our Business Development Program. If you are a college graduate or looking for a career change then our Business Development Program is for you. Anyone interested in gaining Business Development, Sales, and Management experience is encouraged to apply. Business Development Supervisors can expect to be exposed to: - Team Management - Campaign Coordination and Management - Management National Accounts, Marketing, and Sales - Training and development of your colleagues What we believe: - Experience gained is unparalleled - Representatives will grow not only professionally but personally as well - We partner everyone with developed professionals to ensure success - Training and developing transferable skills is the best opportunity for growth to management - Entry level account executives have the opportunity of earning a great income as part of our Business Development Program. Our focus is on establishing relationships with business customers for our clients. All college graduates are encouraged to apply. Anyone with previous management experience is encouraged to apply, but no management experience is necessary!

Job Requirements

An ideal candidate possesses the following qualities:

- A team mentality - Effective interpersonal & excellent communication skills - Demonstrated leadership and team management abilities - Self-confidence, flexibility and sense of humor - Results driven attitude with a hunger for success To apply please submit your resume into the body of an email and send to email listed above!

item.title: Business Administration & Management Majors Welcome - NEW COMPANY
item.dc:creator: DHL
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Business Administration Degree or Management Experience Wanted - College Grads apply!! North American Energy is an organization developed on the belief that an approach to entry levelbusiness sales and consulting based on personal communication will always be more effective and meaningful than the latest technology craze. We are a business focused on the understanding that our people are our future & therefore we want to coach them into a management position. We strive to provide an entrepreneurial environment dedicated to developing successful business leaders. Our success as an organization is a result of maintaining high standards within our firm and working with only those interested in business management and capable of becoming the best of the best at leading others. We promote only from within our own company and reward employeeswith unlimited potential for advancement into a management. This job opportunity involves face to face sales of services to new business prospects. Pay is based on performance. We teach leadership & management as an action, not a title. This ensures that only the best of the best are managing our campaigns and running the businesses in our organization.   Responsibilities include: * Assisting our clients in the retention and acquisition of business customers * Supervising and coaching account managers and account executives. * Learning the business aspect of running a marketing firm * All business & communication aspects in between our clients and their target market  

Job Requirements

No Experience Necessary! APPLY TODAY!

item.title: Information Security Specialist
item.dc:creator: DHL
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

SUMMARY: The Information Security Specialist and IT Auditor position will participate in threat hunting activities; is a member of the Cyber Incident Response Team; and will lead or participate in projects to reduce Risk and achieve/maintain compliance with regulations and standards. This position will use Audit to enhance the Spartan Motors security posture. Strong communication skills and critical thinking are a must. Another critical ability is to learn, and then use effectively and efficiently, processes and technologies. JOB RESPONSIBILITIES: Assists with protecting the confidentiality, integrity and availability of Spartan Motors, Inc.'s data and user identities in compliance with organizational policies and standards. Develops, implements, and reports on the Spartan Motors, Inc.'s Information Security and IT compliance functions designed to protect the Spartan Motors, Inc.s assets. Collaborates with other departments to ensure robust application and compliance of security technologies, strategies, policies and procedures. Assist with design and implementation of business systems to ensure compliance with security requirements and standards. Assist with driving results toward strategic business objectives. Major Duties and Responsibilities:
  • Assists with managing IT Compliance and Information Security framework in adherence with federal, state, Information Security and Risk Management policies, standards and guidelines
  • Assists with managing IT policies, standards, procedures, manuals and guidelines ensuring they are updated and compliant
  • Assists with managing devices that protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of information relating to members, associate, and business in compliance with organizational policies and standards.
  • Lead, coordinate, and execute proactive Information Security consulting to the business and technology teams covering, but not limited to, cyber security, disaster recovery, management of data, network architecture and design, user access management, and management of third parties
  • Assists with developing and maintaining an effective incident management and vulnerability management program driven by Information Security risk assessment
  • Oversee or conducts regular security monitoring and reporting to ensure adequate security defenses, systems and settings are in place to protect against intrusion, theft, destruction or misuse of Spartan Motors, Inc. data and user identities
  • Lead or assist with audits--Sarbanes-Oxley, PCI-DSS and other internal and external regulatory IT audits and reviews
  • Coordinates activities related to vendor audits and collaborate with external auditors for compliance
  • Assists with establishing and maintaining effective communication with vendors, fellow associates, and management on Information Security and IT compliance areas
  • Strictly adheres to and enforces system security policies and follows all company standards. Must comply with applicable laws and regulations, and all company policies
  • Other duties and tasks as assigned
Interpersonal Skills: A significant level of trust, credibility and diplomacy is required. In-depth dialogues, conversations and explanations with associates, direct and indirect reports and outside vendors can be of a sensitive and/or highly confidential nature. Communications may involve motivating, influencing, educating and/or advising others on matters of significance. A high level of interpersonal and verbal communication skills necessary to relate to other people at their systems knowledge level is central to being successful in this position.

Job Requirements

QUALIFICATIONS:
  • A degree in Information Security preferred or a Bachelors degree and relative experience
  • Minimum of 1 year relevant experience
  • Security+, CISSP, CISA or related certifications preferred
  • Proven Skills, Knowledge, and Ability of:
    • Vulnerability Assessment tools and techniques (Required)
    • Security Incident Event Management (Preferred)
    • Penetration Testing/Ethical Hacking (Preferred)
    • Incident Response (Preferred)
    • GRC (SOX, PCI-DSS, etc.)
  • Understanding of applicable data privacy practices and laws
  • Competence with testing tools and procedures for voice and data circuits
  • Advanced level user on Microsoft Office applications
  • Capable of comprehensive listening (understanding the message(s) that is being communicated)
  • Commitment to excellent customer service
  • Flexible and adaptable in regards to learning and understanding new technologies
  • Adept at conducting research into issues and products
  • Strong and consistent attention to detail
  • Able to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
  • Self-motivated with the ability to stay on task
  • Versatile, flexible, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities
  • Creative and innovative team player
  • Strong:
    • Communication skills, verbal and written
    • Interpersonal skills
    • Organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills
  • Experience in training users of all levels to be proficient using computer-based applications
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office
  • Experience with mobile devices (cell phones, smart phones, tablets)

item.title: Project Manager for Manufacturing Plant Construction
item.dc:creator: Subway
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Project Manager for Manufacturing Plant Construction Do you have a background in working on automotive or chemical plant construction projects? We are seeking a Project Manager who can manage several on-going projects, subcontractor management and quality control, as well as coordinate with owners, architects, and engineers regarding budgetary matters and change orders. If you are looking for an opportunity to utilize your construction project management skills and experience, apply today!

Job Requirements

We are very interested in talking to candidates with the following qualifications:
  • 7+ years of management/supervisory experience for at least 3 industrial design/build projects, especially machinery installation
  • Electrical license is a must
  • Experience working on manufacturing plant construction projects
  • Strength with managing subcontractors, scheduling, budgets, and other design/build activities
  • Knowledge of government and company safety regulations/codes, and building codes
  • History of meeting project budget, deadlines, and quality specifications
  • Ability to read drawings and follow testing procedures
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Benefits
  • Great Benefits Package
  • Per Diem
  • 401K
  • Vacation, Sick Leave, and Holiday Pay
Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States. We rely on you to provide us with information that is precisely related to our posting.

item.title: Director of Dietary Services for Long Term Care Healthcare
item.dc:creator: Envato
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Compass Healthcare is conducting a search for an experienced Director of Dietary Services for along Term Care Facility located in Upper Manhattan, NY. Qualified candidates will have prior experience working in a Nursing Home, Assisted Living or Long Term Care facility and be familiar with State Rules and Regulations.   Director of Dietary Services will oversee the daily food serviceoperations in a Long Term Care facility and have responsibility for developing and building a team. You will establish and maintain systems and procedures for the ordering, receiving, storing, preparing and serving of food and related products, as well as menu planning and development. You will assist in unit forecast and budgeting. The Director of Dietary Services ensures that requirements for appropriate sanitation and safety levels in respective areas are met and coordinates and supervises unit personnel regarding production, merchandising, quality and cost control, labor scheduling, staffing and employee training. Conducts periodic inventory and maintain records to comply with company, government and accrediting agency standards. You will also be responsible for daily interaction with the residents and/or facility employees.   Director of Dietary Services Job Requirements Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
  • Position responsible for all aspects ofmanagement in the dietary department including but not limited to management and staffing of the dietary employees, purchasing through company systems, budgeting, weekly QA reporting, monthly QA meetings, relationship building and resident satisfaction
  • Training kitchen staff in cooking, presentation, sanitation
  • Training dining room staff to uphold service standards, menu planning
  • Inventory, food and supply ordering, managing food and labor budgets
  • Putting on first class events for our residents, their families, potential residents, and professional referral source

Job Requirements

Education and Experience:
  • MUST HAVE: Minimum 3-5 years experience working in Sub-Acute, Long Term Healthcare, Short Term Healthcare, or Nursing Home.
  • Kosher law knowledge a plus
  • Bachelors degree in Institution Management, Food and Nutrition or other related fields
  • CDM or equivalent certification.
  • Strong Culinary and Customer Service skills required.
  • Must have computer skills using Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel, and Meal-Tracker a plus
  • Strong Communication, management and team building skills with proven track record required.
  • P&L accountability isa requirementand/or contract managed service experience desired.
Competitive Salary & Benefit Package! Qualified Candidates Please Apply Now for Immediate Consideration! www.compass4jobs.com

item.title: Director of Security Architecture
item.dc:creator: Airbnb
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Director of Security Architecture Applied Resource Group is looking for a Director of Security Architecture for one of our enterprise clients in the North Atlanta area. This is the lead role for identification, analysis, evaluation, life cycle management, and adoption of security support resources and services across the enterprise. Serves as a security expert for applications, software/systems development lifecycle, database, network, and platform (operating system), cloud, and product line. Contributes to the development and maintenance of information security strategies and analyzes business impact and exposure based on emerging security threats, vulnerabilities, and risks.   Responsibilities(first 5 cover 80% of important job functions)
  1. Determine security requirements by evaluating business strategies and requirements; research information security standards; conduct system security and vulnerability analyses and risk assessments.
  2. Create and manage security standards and guiding principles to help define and govern the future state security architecture, processes, information systems and infrastructure.
  3. Identify, analyze, evaluate, life cycle management, and adoption of security support resources and services across the enterprise
  4. Assists in directing and supporting security framework
  5. Develop security standards and roadmaps to migrate to defined security standards
  6. Maintain security by monitoring and ensuring compliance to standards, policies, and procedures
  7. Develop and conduct training programs.
  8. Upgrade security systems by monitoring security environment; identifying security gaps; evaluating and implementing enhancements.
  9. Prepare system security reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data and trends.
  10. Assist in the development and implementation of a data security architecture framework
  11. Track and understand emerging security practices and standards
  12. Contribute to the iterative development of application, platform, and data security requirements for all solutions
  13. Conduct security reviews of mobile and web-based solutions
  14. Perform static and dynamic code analysis and works with teams to triage and remediate findings
  15. Respond to external requests and reports related to product and solution security
  16. Work closely with release management to review software security requirements prior to release
  17. Assess, obtain and deploy tools and software solutions to aid in SDL and security testing processes
  18. Provide security designs to IT projects in the category of new vendor, new technology, and new capabilities.
 

Job Requirements

Qualifications
  • 8 - 10 years' experience in the information security industry.
  • 5 years experience in Security Architectrole
  • CISSP Certification
  • PCI, SOX, ISO 27002 certification
  • Network Operations background and/or Systems Engineering background.
  • Demonstrated experience assessing risk and developing security controls at a business-appropriate level.
  • Experience and detailed technical knowledge in security engineering, system and network security, authentication and security protocols, cryptography, and application security
  • Experience with encryption, consolidated logging, vulnerability management, and DDOS prevention designs
  • Experience in software security principals (i.e. OWASP, penetration testing, application testing)
  • Experience in application-level vulnerability testing and auditing
  • Detailed knowledge of system security vulnerabilities and remediation techniques, including penetration testing and the development of exploits
  • Knowledge of network and web related protocols (e.g., TCP/IP, UDP, IPSEC, HTTP, HTTPS, routing protocols)
  • Proven experience in large, complex enterprise-wide initiatives.
  • Ability to work in a team in a matrix with multiple reporting lines, and may extend outside the organization including suppliers, partners and customers.
  Education
  • Bachelors Degree in Management Information Systems or Computer Science, or equivalent experience is required. Masters preferred.

item.title: Electrical Design Engineer
item.dc:creator: Envato
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

TLC is currently looking for an Electrical Engineer to work in Cocoa, FL.

TLC Engineering for Architecture is a dynamic engineering firm with a diversity of talent, expertise and skill to deliver design projects that span the major markets and around the world. With more than62 years of experience, 12 offices, a commitment to sustainable design and an enthusiastic embrace of leading-edge technology, TLC ranks among the largest and most respected engineering firms in the nation. Responsibilities:
  • Electrical design for a diverse range of commercial buildings (hospitality, airports, amusement park, large retail, multi-use, K-12, sports arenas and performing art centers, etc).
  • Prepareload calculations, select equipment, layout electrical systems using AutoCad or Revit.
  • Coordinate with architect, owner-client and other disciplines on lighting, power and low voltage systems.
  • Answer Contractors RFIs and provide amendments along with written responses

Job Requirements

Basic Qualifications Include:
  • 3+ years of experience in similar MEP, Consulting orArchitectural Engineering firm
  • Familiarity using AutoCad or Revit
  • Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering or Bachelor of Science in Architectural Engineering
Preferred Qualifications:
  • EIT or PE License

TLC is your next OpportunityOffering Great Benefits & Competitive Salary

Submit Your Profile NOW!

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Bruce Poole and Nigel Platts-Martin opened Chez Bruce in 1995. From the outset, it was their intention to serve the very best food and drink but within a relaxed, informal yet thoroughly professionally orchestrated environment. At Chez Bruce we are not particularly into gadgets and tricks in the kitchen. Home-made charcuterie, slow cooked braises, offal, warm and cold salads, classical desserts and bread-making could be listed as specialities. We also take the cheese board very seriously indeed and it forms an integral part of the restaurant's day-to-day life. The Directors of the restaurant are fanatical wine-lovers and are very proud of the restaurant's wine list which truly is one of the very best in the UK.
business meetings, dining, romantic, special occasion
French cooking with hints of the Mediterranean

item.title: Project Superintendent for Manufacturing Plant Construction
item.dc:creator: Airbnb
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

ProjectSuperintendent for Manufacturing Plant Construction Do you have a background in working on automotive or chemical plant construction projects? We are seeking a ProjectSuperintendent who can manage several on-going projects, subcontractor management and quality control, as well as coordinate with owners, architects, and engineers regarding budgetary matters and change orders. This is a hands-on position. If you are looking for an opportunity to utilize your construction project management skills and experience, apply today!

Job Requirements

We are very interested in talking to candidates with the following qualifications:
  • 5+ years of management/supervisory experience for at least 3 industrial design/build projects, especially machinery installation
  • Experience working on manufacturing plant construction projects
  • Strength with managing subcontractors, scheduling, budgets, and other design/build activities
  • Knowledge of government and company safety regulations/codes, and building codes
  • History of meeting project budget, deadlines, and quality specifications
  • Ability to read drawings and follow testing procedures
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Benefits
  • Great Benefits Package
  • Per Diem
  • 401K
  • Vacation, Sick Leave, and Holiday Pay
Candidates must be legally authorized to work in the United States. We rely on you to provide us with information that is precisely related to our posting.

item.title: Manager of Clinical Services - Healthcare - Home Health
item.dc:creator: FedEx
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Full-Time Nurse, Manager Clinical Services Home Health Farmington Hills, MI If you're a registered nurse with at least two years of experience in home health we hope you'll consider becoming our clinical services manager. It's a position where you'll develop leadership skills and forge relationships that canopen opportunitiesto advancement. You'll ensure ourhome healthteam delivers high quality of carewhile providing ongoing case management for all of our patients. You'll touch the lives of both our patients and care providers. As an educator and mentor you'll find ways to address deficiencies in clinical standards, care and compliance, along with improvements to OASIS and medical records. We're looking for someone who will provide constructive feedback to our associates and review agency outcomes. You'll get a flexible work schedule, great benefits and the support you need to excel at your job and grow your career. Your responsibilities: * Supervise, monitor, and ensure competencies and performance of an assigned home health care team and assuring the delivery of quality home health services * Provide ongoing case management of all patients assuring an accurate evaluation and treatment plan, maintaining our quality model, and utilizing services appropriately to achieve optimal outcomes * Review electronically submitted documentation and provide feedback to clinicians regarding deficiencies or OASIS corrections to ensure the medical records reflect compliance with medical necessity, homebound status, visit utilization supported by individual patient assessment/ documentation support and transition (discharge) planning * Review and approve final Plan of Care (485) within Electronic Medical Records (EMR) system * Review patient schedules to ensure appropriate coordination of care and clinical needs * Work directly with the assigned home health care team with the ongoing implementation of approved work methods, patient care model, and procedures that reflect elements essential to rendering high quality care Brookdale. Bringing new life to senior living. A career with Brookdale Healthcare Services has never been so rewarding! Brookdale Home Health is ranked among the Top Ten largest home heath companies in the country. Many of our agencies carry a five-star rating and are recognized by Decision Health as Home Care Elite agencies. We own and operate more than 80+ agencies nationwide, serving approximately 17,000 patients throughout our Brookdale Home Health Division.

Job Requirements

Required skills and qualifications: *Valid RN license within practice state * Two years of experience within a licensed and certified (Medicare) home health agency. * Competent in Federal (Medicare) and Local standards including Conditions of Participation and Local Coverage Determinations * Basic level computer skills including Outlook, Word and Excel * Must enjoy working with the senior population Questions? Please contact Marsha Gragg at[Click Here to Email Your Resum]or 704-297-0765 If you're a Brookdale associate, please consider referring someone through the Good People Program! Brookdale is an EOE-(Equal Opportunity Employer) and drug-free workplace. Brookdale offers a number of benefits to full-time associates including, but not limited to: medical, dental, vision, disability, life, paid time off, educational reimbursement. All associates, age 21 and older, are eligible to participate in the 401(k) retirement savings plan.

item.title: Senior Associate- Executive Search- HR & CEO/Board
item.dc:creator: Levis
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

  Position Reports To: Managing Director   The Company: Allegis Partners - one of nine operating companies within the $12 billion privately held global human capital organization, Allegis Group - is a nimble and creative retained executive search consultancy. The firm is comprised of six U.S. offices, with 20+ employees from top-tier executive search firms, and relevant corporate experience from marquee global companies. Over the past two years our managing directors and senior associates came together attracted by a common goal and desire to conduct search with a more compelling, client focused approach.   Our two U.S. core practice areas are functional Human Resources the largest and most robust HR practice in the industry - and Board Directors & CEO executive search.   Job Summary: This position is responsible for providing support to Managing Directors and Directors in all aspects of the search process to include execution, targeting, outreach and assessment of candidates on the phone, through email, ATS database, social media and at times in-person. The Senior Associate will also be responsible for collaborating with the research and knowledge management functions prior to and after searches being launched. Senior Associates may also be involved in managing search schedules (candidates and clients), attending and presenting in client status calls and meetings and preparing drafts of various search documents. Position is primarily responsible for supporting search execution, but will also contribute to the business development efforts of the firm, to include identifying business development targets, preparation of pitch materials and at times participation in new business presentations. Position may support executive level searches in one or two defined verticals and various senior functional roles. Essential Functions:
  • The Senior Associate will be primarily aligned to at least one Allegis Partners Practice (i.e. Human Resources, CEO or Board of Directors) but may also support executive searches in other strategic industries and functions.
  • Works with the MD/Director on each project to develop a search execution plan
  • Participates in the execution of multiple retained searches to include research, position descriptions, candidate write-ups, targeting, contacting and evaluating candidates, etc.
  • Creates target lists of potential clients for MD or Director and participates in client meetings
  • Source, cold call and present a compelling story to secure target candidates and interface with them through the search process, providing a high level of candidate care
  • Respond to MD or Director in a timely manner, with the mandate to meet all timelines for client deliverables for qualified, interested candidates
  • Understand the client position thoroughly, and execute accordingly, screening candidates for the position fit", from a content, cultural and functional perspective
  • Proactively network and seek out the candidates in the most expeditious and cost effective manner. Leverage business and client networks to market career/client opportunities
  • Help manage all related administrative duties related to the job search process including assistance with the interview scheduling process when necessary
  • Ensure ATS database is updated with required client and candidate information
  • Gathering, recording and sharing market intelligence
  • Mentor and train more junior members of the firm to ensure their continued career development and the needs of the firm.
  • Other duties as assigned

Job Requirements

Minimum Education and/or Experience:
  • Executive search experience within a defined industry, vertical or functional focus
  • Four year college degree required
  • Reputation for client service, delivering results
  • Unassailable ethics and integrity
  • Proven ability to successfully and efficiently complete searches while ensuring the highest standards of quality and customer service
  Requisite Abilities and/or Skills:
  • Excellent research experience and skills
  • Exceptional learning agility
  • Ability to meet deadlines and produce high quality work
  • High energy and ability to work in a fast-paced team environment
  • Extraordinary dedication to client service
  • Detail oriented, no detail is too small
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Flexibility in dealing with shifting priorities.
  • Organizational skills, including proven ability to prioritize and to follow up
  • Self-starter
  • Outgoing personality embraces phone contact with prospective candidates and cold-calling
  • Team oriented and collaborative
  • Commitment to ethics, equal opportunity and diversity
  • Database management experience
  • Strong knowledge of technology (Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint and Word)
  • Proficiency with internet and social media recruiting tools and technologies
  • AIRS certification a plus
Core Competencies:
  • Search Execution
  • Understanding the Market and Client and Candidate Needs
  • Work Habits & Approach
  • Competitive self-starter
Disclaimer:The above statements are intended to describe the essential job functions, general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

item.title: CEO Aventura Hospital & Medical Center
item.dc:creator: Google
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

JOB SUMMARY Under a combination of administrative and executive direction, provides leadership and directs the overall operation of the hospital consistent with policies and objectives of the hospital and its advisory or governing Board. In this regard, the CEO plans, organizes, applies, directs, controls and evaluates all resources (human resources, facilities, equipment, capital and similar resources) invested in the franchise. The CEO shall use all resources to generate measurable returns to benefit the company, the Community, the Physician and most of all, the Patient. GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES Develops a long range course of action or set of goals to ensure successful realization of the organizations vision. Establishes clear goals that align a units efforts with the organizations vision. Ensures synergies between people, processes, and strategies to drive execution of business objectives. Builds a competitively superior organization by attracting, developing, and retaining talent to ensure that people with the right skills and motivations are in the right place at the right time to meet business needs. Builds and drives sustained revenue growth. Builds strategic alliances outside the organization to create business opportunities and execute business strategies. Develops an organizational culture that leads to ongoing excellence and effective growth of the business while maintaining the highest integrity.

Job Requirements

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE In depth and up to date knowledge of hospital administration typically acquired through the completion of a Masters degree in hospital administration. Knowledge of the health care field as well as refined managerial skills which are typically acquired through experience as a COO. Member of ACHE preferred. SPECIAL QUALIFICATIONS Member of ACHE preferred. Current knowledge of Joint Commission, state, and federal guidelines, regulations and standards. Demonstrated expertise in negotiation, coaching, and interpersonal skills. Advanced skills in financial management.

item.title: Director of Finance For a fast growing company in a desired industry!
item.dc:creator: FedEx
item.content:encoded:
Tivoli Park is Ljubljana's largest and most beautiful park, stretching right into the city centre. It was designed in 1813 by the French engineer Jean Blanchard and created by joining together the parks which had surrounded Podturn and Cekin Mansions. The park, covering an area of approximately five square kilometres, is crossed by three grand horse chestnut tree-lined walks and landscaped with ornamental flower beds, interesting trees and numerous statues and fountains. The park area blends into the slopes of the Ronik hill, to which it is connected by several walking paths and a trim trail with several exercise stations along its length. Jakopi Promenade, a popular outdoor gallery Tivoli Park's scenic Jakopi Promenade (Jakopievo sprehajalie), designed by the architect Joe Plenik in the central part of Tivoli Park, has become a well known outdoor venue for exhibitions of large-format photographs, open throughout the year.

Location details

Since its general layout was made in 1813, Tivoli Park has seen several expansions and re-landscaping projects, including the building of a fish pond on its western edge in 1880. Next to the pond there is a small botanical garden with a glasshouse, whose management was entrusted to the Ljubljana Botanic Garden on its 200th anniversary in 2010. The glasshouse houses a permanent exhibition of tropical and carnivorous plants. Across the way from the fish pond, a children's playground was built in 1942 and refurbished with new play equipment in 1994. Between 1921 and 1939, an extensive re-design project was undertaken by the architect Joe Plenik, who designed the park's wide Jakopi Promenade, which ends at the bottom of the stairway leading to Tivoli Mansion. The promenade is named after the Slovenian Impressionist painter Rihard Jakopi. In 1929, the Letno Kopalie Ilirija outdoor swimming pool was built at the edge of the Tivoli park to a design by Stanko Bloudek. At the time when it was built it was the most modern swimming pool in the Kingdom of Yugoslavia. In memory of Bloudek, a sports park bearing his name was later built in front of the Tivoli park's Cekin Mansion (Cekinov grad). It included tennis and basketball courts, a roller-skating rink and a children's playground designed by the architect Marjan Boi. In 1965, Boi also designed Dvorana Tivoli, a hall intended for sports events and larger concerts. Not far away, a sports and recreational centre with an indoor swimming pool, fitness facilities and a bowling alley was built to a design by Fedja Koir in 1973.

item.title: Assistant Lead Construction Superintendent
item.dc:creator: Airbnb
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Edward Rose & Sons is a privately-owned, national real estate developer headquartered in Bloomfield Hills, Michigan with additional offices in Indianapolis, Indiana and Flint and Kalamazoo, Michigan. We have built over 80,000 single-family homes and apartment units and have been actively engaged in the construction and property management of residential communities since 1921. The company is self-financed and pays quickly. In 2008, the company entered the Senior Living market and has since completed three campuses. We are now in the process of building three more Senior Living projects. Edward Rose & Sons is currently seeking an Assistant Lead Construction Superintendent. This position is responsible for assisting the lead Superintendent with the overall day-to-day supervision of field related construction activities. Candidates must have extensive experience with 3-story, wood frame and/or non-com construction, hospitality level finishes, and multi-family facilities. This position requires working at a multi-family project. The ideal candidate will have 5+ years of experience in the construction industry, and be available to work full-time with occasional Saturdays (as needed). We are looking for someone who has a solid work ethic, ambition to advance, and hands-on experience with various tools and construction tasks. Properly performed, this position has advancement potential.Primary Responsibilities:
  • Managing the rough in construction process with heavy involvement in the MEPs.
  • Planning, managing, and coordination of the construction process from framing through drywall of buildings, on a timely and economic basis.
  • Ensuring that the contractors work is performed in accordance with contractual and quality obligations.
  • Assisting the Superintendent in managing subordinate staff, overseeing the quality of construction, and ensuring safety on the job site.
  • Proactively looks for any issues that could impede progress and takes responsibility for solving them.
  • Additional responsibilities to be assigned later.

Job Requirements

  • Ability to effectively and professionally communicatewith a diverse group of individuals.
  • Ability to review and interpret the plans, specifications and contracts as they relate to each individual trade involved in the construction of the project.
  • Comprehending the means and methods of construction associated with 3-story, wood frame and/or non-com construction, along with the proper function and fitness of purpose of the final product.
  • Knowledge of and ability to follow and enforce all OSHA guidelines.
  • Must have a valid drivers license and reliable transportation.
  • Must have a solid work ethic, ability to work independently, and a desire to be in a leadership position.
Employees are required to be honest and trustworthy with a satisfactory background. A valid driver's license and reliable transportation will be required as this position will entail the operation of a personal and potentially a company vehicle. BENEFITS & COMPENSATION:
  • Comprehensive benefits packages, including 401k plan with substantial company match
  • Generous paid time off plan
  • Competitive compensation program
  • Opportunities for advancement
  • Great working environment
  • Generous discount on apartments
Salary is negotiable and commensurate with experience. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, and we affirmatively seek diversity in our workforce. We recruit qualified candidates and advance our employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, disability, genetic information, ethnic or national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other status or characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

item.title: Electrical Engineer
item.dc:creator: DHL
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

TLC is currently looking for an Electrical Engineer to work in Cocoa, FL.

TLC Engineering for Architecture is a dynamic engineering firm with a diversity of talent, expertise and skill to deliver design projects that span the major markets and around the world. With more than62 years of experience, 12 offices, a commitment to sustainable design and an enthusiastic embrace of leading-edge technology, TLC ranks among the largest and most respected engineering firms in the nation. Responsibilities:
  • Electrical design for a diverse range of commercial buildings (hospitality, airports, amusement park, large retail, multi-use, K-12, sports arenas and performing art centers, etc).
  • Prepareload calculations, select equipment, layout electrical systems using AutoCad or Revit.
  • Coordinate with architect, owner-client and other disciplines on lighting, power and low voltage systems.
  • Answer Contractors RFIs and provide amendments along with written responses

Job Requirements

Basic Qualifications Include:
  • 3+ years of experience in similar MEP, Consulting orArchitectural Engineering firm
  • Familiarity using AutoCad or Revit
  • Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering or Bachelor of Science in Architectural Engineering
Preferred Qualifications:
  • EIT or PE License

TLC is your next OpportunityOffering Great Benefits & Competitive Salary

Submit Your Profile NOW!

item.title: Director Application Architecture
item.dc:creator: YouTube
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Energize your career with Westinghouse Electric Company! Our commitment to safe, clean nuclear energy is second to none, and were proud of our rich heritage of technical innovation and commitment to our global customers success. If you are interested in being a part of a company that values exceeding customer expectations and providing future generations around the globe with emission-free energy, we want to hear from you. We currently have an exciting opportunity for a Director, Application Architecture. The Director, Application Architecture, is responsible for establishing the overall technical design of all global software solutions and making all technical decisions within the enterprise. The application architect collaborates with business analysts, who write and deliver the functional specification, the architecture team who define the infrastructure required for solutions and the development team who develop/install the software solution. This is a highly technical role with a strong client-facing focus, providing the leadership and technical competence to deliver excellent client solutions. While there is likely to be limited, if any, hands on development, exceptional knowledge of software development practices is required in order to make sure the optimal solution is designed and that the developers work to the highest quality. The Director will be responsible for the following: Define and document the overarching application architecture (application roadmap) for all software development projects and installed software within the Westinghouse global environment Work closely with infrastructure technical staff to ensure solutions adhere to infrastructure standards and fit their strategic enterprise architecture Collaborate with senior business leadership to understand future requirements and direction of the business to ensure IT solution readiness and alignment Define and organize development tasks and ensure accurate estimation of these tasks Work closely with members of the development team to ensure that the software design and implementation adheres to the governance standards, architectural goals and quality standards Provide support to the business analysts, and other project team members, during functional requirements definition to ensure that existing solutions are leveraged and that recommended solutions conform to the established applications roadmap Undertake other duties as directed by Information Technology senior management commensurate with the post Additionally, at the senior level, the duties and responsibilities include: Carrying out the above duties on all disparate technologies and/or integration with many third party systems Actively seeking opportunities to contribute improvements to Westinghouses application delivery process Mentoring junior members of the IT organization Acting as a focal point of expertise on key application technologies or skills Reviewing and/or collaborating on enterprise architectures EOE of Minorities/Females/Vets/Disability Please know, your application will only be considered if it is completed and submitted via the Westinghouse careers website. You may search and apply to our jobs using the following link: http://www.jobs.net/jobs/westinghousenuclear/en-us/all-jobs/

Job Requirements

Bachelor degree in Information or Computer Science, advanced degree preferred. Minimum of ten years experience with atleastthree in application architecture. Essential Experience and Knowledge Experience in application architecture Experience of the full software development lifecycle, delivering systems over multiple complex implementations Experience of architecting software solutions with demanding non-functional requirements such as performance, high availability, reliability, security, etc. Knowledge of a wide range of open source projects and components Excellent knowledge and understanding of object oriented design techniques and patterns Knowledge of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, particularly SAP Knowledge of multiple standard software development methodologies Knowledge of integration patterns and technologies Knowledge of database design and network/infrastructure design experience Experience working with international operations, regulations, and cultures. Experience supporting extensive regulatory, safety, and quality requirements. Familiar with six-sigma and other tools for the analytical evaluation of application, system, and process options Knowledge of IT trends and able to articulate a vision for a future IT state in multiple domains Working knowledge of the ITIL management framework Client interaction experience Essential Skills and Attributes Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written Will be confident, articulate and literate, presenting him/herself as a professional at all times Must be self-motivated, disciplined, able to work on own initiative and take responsibility for own work Business acumen and process knowledge for the order to cash business cycle in both professional services and discrete manufacturing Will be committed to the achievement of excellence Constantly strives to discover and learn new technologies Ability to balance client business priorities with technical requirements Benefits: Employees enjoy a comprehensive benefits package including Competitive Pay, Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, Short Term Disability & Long Term Disability, Life & Accident Insurance, Flexible Spending Accounts, 401(k) Savings Plan, and Paid Vacation. We also offer a number of work/life programs such as flextime and a variety of training and development opportunities.

item.title: Retail/ Business Banking Portfolio Manager
item.dc:creator: Airbnb
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

About Us Since 1868, Sandy Spring Bank has provided outstanding financial services and remained committed to being a strong, local, independent bank. Our community offices throughout Maryland, Northern Virginia and the District of Columbia serve the unique needs of individuals, businesses and organizations every day.   We are seeking competent, motivated employees who share our commitment to being remarkable. To attract and retain these quality individuals, we provide a market driven salary administration program and a comprehensive benefits package. Sandy Spring takes pride in offering a broad benefits program to its most valuable asset.our staff. About The Job Sandy Spring Bank is currently recruiting a Retail/Business Banking Portfolio Manager. If you are the chosen candidate, you will be responsible for small business portfolio administration, post approval and post-closing client support and servicing of small business loans up to $750,000 and specialty lending program loans up to $1.5MM, both secured and unsecured to ensure all small business loan portfolios are properly managed according to Sandy Spring Bank credit and risk policies.   Duties include providing informative consultative support to Business Banking, Retail Branches and Small Business Underwriters, as it relates to small business loan applications, loan documentation requirements and loan processes, managing the renewal process by gathering required financial information directly from the borrower, performing due diligence review of loan documentation requirements for Loan Center approvals, renewals and preparing financial statement and tax return spreads where required. You will be responsible for the reviewing of expiring ACH exposure clients according to the established ACH Credit Policy and Guidelines.   Areas of focus:
  • Portfolio Administration
  • Maintenance and Client Servicing
  • Loan Processing

Job Requirements

Required Skills:
  • Work requires a broad level of professional experience in commercial or small business lending.
  • Position requires 3 to 5 years work experience in commercial lending or small business lending.
  • Must be able to multi-task in a high volume environment.
  • Small business loan documentation and financial statement knowledge required. Demonstrated familiarity with small business branch processes and loan documents is required.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of business financial statement, business tax returns, personal financial statement and personal tax returns is required.
  • Prior business and personal financial statement spreading knowledge highly preferred.
  • Intermediate experience with standard PC based software to prepare correspondence, reports and other documents as needed.
  • Strong communication skills are needed to effectively work with internal/external clients to explain products, processes and interpret policy.
  • Advanced problem solving skills are needed to find solutions to problems that are technically complex and require collection, interpretation, and analysis of data from diverse sources as required. Work is under minimal supervision, where the work requires independent judgment in the interpretation of existing policies and procedures and the selection of alternative work routines.
Compensation: We pay competitively to Market, and offer a 401(k) plan with employer match both pre-and post-tax contributions. We also offer an Employee Stock Purchase Plan along with the following benefits:
  • Free Banking, including discounts on loans
  • Paid Time Off
  • Tuition Assistance
  In addition for employees who work 30 hours per week:  
  • Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
  • Paid Parental Leave
  • Life Insurance
  • Health Care and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
Sandy Spring Bank is an equal employment opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We maintain a drug-free workplace environment and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.   If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a position with Sandy Spring Bank, please call our job line at 1-800-399-5919 and select option 5. Requests are considered on a case-by-case basis.

item.title: Patient Advocate and Healthcare Administration - Bachelor's Degree
item.dc:creator: Google
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Recognized as one of the Fastest Growing US Healthcare Companies, We are currently expanding multiple departments within our operations support, marketing, Provider Relations and customer advocacy departments. We are seeking to add over 20 new positions within the next 30 days -- recent graduates and healthcare administration/client services reps are encouraged to apply -- must be comfortable handling client communications via the phone and email. Recent graduates with solid communication skills and a desire to get real working experience should apply! Previous healthcare experience and a Bachelor's degree highly preferred. ESSENTIAL DUTIES INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING:
Position Overview
  • Make outbound calls to schedule patients in a timely manner to ensure that internal and external metrics are met.
  • Understand interdepartmental procedures, policies and comply with them
  • Meet Department goals for Quality and Quantity of work input.
  • Complete special projects or tasks as assigned by the supervisor
  • Provide best in class customer service to all callers
  • Work on cases that requires investigation for missing information that is necessary to schedule patients for their initial evaluations
  • Coordinates the execution of various insurance, healthcare and pharmaceutical services contracts
  • Act as liaison between insurance providers, customers, resources and other internal constituents
  • Review case information/consult with case management to determine if new cases need to be opened
  • Request information from insurance companies and maintain professional communications with individuals across the health field
  • Establishes and maintains strong relationships with internal clients, customers and vendors
  • Perform general administrative tasks as needed
Huge room for growth for Recent Graduates!

Job Requirements

RequirementsJob Requirements
  • Strong Communication skills
  • Bachelor's Degree required
  • Experience internship in a healthcare, pharmaceutical or insurance setting a PLUS!
  • Detail oriented, solid organizational skills
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office -- Excel, Word, Powerpoint, etc.
  • Assertive and outgoing personality
  • Must have ability to multitask and work independently
  • drug/background screens
  • Professional attitude
  • Strong communication skills
  • Inc. 500, Fastest Growing Private Companies
  • Employee social events! Great work environment
  • On-site Gym
  • Free Friday Lunches!
  • Company mixers
Pathfinders has permanent and contract to perm jobs in Wayne, King of Prussia, West Chester, Conshohocken, Malvern, Media, Plymouth Meeting, Exton, Collegeville, Phoenixville, Radnor, Bristol, Yardley, Langhorne and Center City Philadelphia. We have openings for Recent Graduates, Executive Assistants, Receptionists,Dataentry, Customer Service, Call Center, Admin Assistants, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable,InsideSales, Marketing Coordinators, Account Executives, File Clerks, Technical Support, Help Desk and Junior Network Administrators..

item.title: Senior Client Associate - Officer | Private Client Group - Brooklyn
item.dc:creator: FedEx
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Senior Client Associate - Officer | Private Client Group Brooklyn
Join a winning team! Signature Bank has been ranked among the Top 10 on Forbes' list of Best Banks in America for six consecutive years! Signature Bank, member FDIC, is a New York-based full-service commercial bank with private client offices throughout the New York metropolitan area. The Banks growing network of private client banking teams serves the needs of privately owned businesses, their owners and senior managers. Signature Bank offers a wide variety of business and personal banking products and services. The Bank operates Signature Financial, LLC, a specialty finance subsidiary focused on equipment finance and leasing, transportation financing and taxi medallion financing. Investment, brokerage, asset management and insurance products and services are offered through the Banks subsidiary, Signature Securities Group Corporation, a licensed broker-dealer, investment adviser and member FINRA/SIPC.   Senior Client Associate - Officer | Private Client Group Brooklyn In this position, you will provide personalized banking services to Signatures private banking clients. Your broad knowledge of banking products will aid you in responding to inquiries and requests regarding accounts.   Primary responsibilities include:
  • Provide excellent client service, resolve issues and respond to client inquiries/requests regarding accounts
  • Process wire transfers, prepare and compile new client applications, as well as open new accounts
  • Ensure compliance with wire transfer requirement, as well as new account opening documentation
  • Coordinate and assist back office operations in resolving credit problems, delinquent payment issues and other related concerns
  • Promote and cross-sell products and services appropriate to client needs

Job Requirements

Senior Client Associate - Officer | Private Client Group Brooklyn
Qualifications:
  • Minimum 5 years of related banking experience in a similar role
  • Strong interpersonal and client service skills with the ability to make independent decisions and manage time effectively
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Broad knowledge of financial products, services and compliance, including KYC-AML
  • High School Diploma or equivalent
  Signature Bank offers a competitive compensation (BONUS PROGRAM), an excellent health benefits package including, 401(k) plan with generous company match, gym reimbursement, pet insurance, tuition reimbursement, award winning wellness program, and much more for qualified employees!   Service is our cornerstone! View available Careers with Signature at www.signatureny.com/careers   We are an Equal Opportunity Employer No Agencies Please Relocation or interview travel expensesare not available for this role

item.title: Office Administration / Customer Service
item.dc:creator: Google
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Express Employment Professionalsoffers a full range of employment solutions to local businesses with both full-time and temporary staffing. With over 700 offices in the United States, Canada, and South Africa, we aggressively seek talented, enthusiastic individuals who can help us achieve our purpose of helping people succeed. We are offering an exciting job opportunity asOffice Administration / Customer Service. ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES and BASIC DUTIES: The duties of this position include all general office tasks, which may include some of the following:learning every position within the office to be a back-up when needed, multi-tasking, typing,Microsoft Excel / Word,data entry, and providing customer service to both external and internal groups.

Job Requirements

OFFICE ADMINISTRATION / CUSTOMER SERVICE- The best candidates have: Excellent communication skills -- both verbal & written. Excellent computer skills. Comfortable multi-tasking. Ability to provide excellent customer service. Good organizational skills. Ability to work efficiently under pressure. Good attention to detail.

item.title: Business Administration & Management Majors Welcome!
item.dc:creator: Envato
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Business Administration Degree or Management Experience Wanted - College Grads apply!!

US Energy Company is an organization developed on the belief that an approach to entry levelbusiness sales andconsulting based on personal communication will always be more effective and meaningful than the latest technology craze. We are a business focused on the understanding that our people are our future & therefore we want to coach them into a management position. We strive to provide an entrepreneurial environment dedicated to developing successful business administration leaders. Our success as an organization is a result of maintaining high standards within our business and working with only those interested in business management/administration and capable of becoming the best of the best at leading others. We promote only from within our own business and reward employeeswith unlimited potential for advancement into a management. This business opportunity involves face to face sales of services to new business prospects. Pay is based on performance. We teach leadership & management as an action, not a title. This ensures that only the best of the best are managing our campaigns and running the businesses in our organization. Responsibilities for Business Leaders include: * Assisting our clients in the retention and acquisition of business customers * Supervising and coaching account managers and account executives. * Learning the business aspect of running a marketing firm * All business & communication aspects in between our clients and their target market

Job Requirements

***NO EXPERIENCE NECESSARY*** For more information check out our website at: www.us-energycompany.com/

item.title: Director of Information Technology
item.dc:creator: Levis
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Our client is currently seeking a Director of Information Technology
IT SERVICE DESK
Manage the IT Service Desk (2 FTEs) and ensure incidents, tickets and calls are being resolved effectively.
Maintain the systems and skills required to support the business from an IT Service Desk perspective.
IT OPERATIONS
Manage the IT Life-Cycle of all end point technology deployed throughout the environment. Establish & Maintain system uptime Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and measure performance against those metrics.
IT ENGINEERING
Set the technical direction for IT Systems infrastructure. Manage all systems infrastructure deployed throughout the Enterprise.
Stay current with applicable technologies as they relate to systems infrastructure
Storage, Virtualization, Security, Networking, Communications
Build strong relationships with key service providers and internal corporate resources to maintain high skill levels within strategic technology disciplines.
Windows Domain Infrastructure (E-Mail, User Management, Domain Controller, File & Print Services, Workstation Management, Patch Management)
Office 365
Windows Server
Active Directory
Data Center Infrastructure (UPS, Cabling, Racking & Cooling)
Warehouse Infrastructure (Scanners, Wireless, Printers, Ship Stations)
Corporate Office Infrastructure (Printers, Scanners, Wireless, Video Conferencing, Phone System, Corporate File System)
Network Infrastructure (Routing & Switching, Wireless, Internet)
Security Infrastructure (Firewalls, Anti-Virus, Security Policy & Procedures)
Application & Server Infrastructure
Windows Server
Linux, Apache, MySQL & PHP
Mac OS
Hyper V Virtualization
Product Design, Development & Sourcing, Merchandising, Account Management, Supply Chain, Accounting, Art Management Systems
Polygon Software
Dynamics GP
FileMaker
vTechnologies
SPS Commerce
Other job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Develop, implement and monitor the strategic plan for the IT Operations, systems infrastructure, IT Service Desk, and applications that support the business.
Lead, develop, mentor and coach a team of three FTE s
Manage staff performance evaluation, salary and bonus reviews, and career growth planning.
Responsible for the overall performance and availability of all systems infrastructure. Analyze and recommend upgrades/changes.
Maintain effective operations plans, processes and procedures. Creates and implement enterprise standards and documentation.
Partner with outside vendors to resolve problems or issues, as well as assess products and service capabilities.
Collaborate with internal clients to assess information technology needs and expectations, researches networking requirements, evaluates network technologies, hardware and software, and prepares detailed architectural and installation plans.
Prepares status reports and keeps management informed of project status and any related issues. Develop performance metrics and measurement techniques for infrastructure and operations related services.
Manages telecommunication vendor relationship partnerships to facilitate the ongoing, growth, development of the enterprise.
QUALIFICATIONS
Must be competent with various aspects of expense management, including cost allocations, cost projections, expense tracking, and the ability to perform acceptable accurate fiscal estimates.
Strong project management skills; experience in organizing, planning, and executing large-scale projects from early planning stages through to implementation, involving internal personnel, contractors, and vendors.
Excellent leadership, communication, analytical, problem-solving, organizational and planning skills are essential to success in this position. In addition, a demonstrated experience in communicating and managing resources related to complex technical operational concepts and support and continued development of a diverse wide-area network incorporating multiple data-centers is necessary.
The ideal candidate will exhibit a high level of personal integrity, poise and professionalism, as well as, a strong knowledge of system design and technical control methodologies, web and communications technologies and IT practices/trends
Experience in Manufacturing and/or Apparel systems- ERP, WMS, PLM, etc.
EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE
A four-year college degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Information Systems, Computer Science or a related field is required.
5-7 years of prior experience managing technical groups is required. Strong preference is given to apparel experience.

item.title: Training and Development Manager
item.dc:creator: Airbnb
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Our national client is looking to hire a talented & effective Training & Development Manager who will create and implement strategic training programs to support the business strategy. The ideal Training & Development Manager candidate has:
  • Experience in utilizing proven methodologies on Training Effectiveness
  • Exceptional communication skills, verbal and written
  • At least 10 years of demonstrated expertise in the development and delivery of training products
  • Master's Degree in Organizational Development or Human Resources with emphasis in Training and Development.
Salary Up to $105,000 PLUS Excellent Benefits This Training & Development Manager is responsible for the following areas to train and enhance the capability and performance of the organizations workforce:
  • Assess the organizations current training and development needs
  • Design, implementation and evaluation of current programs
  • Review and evaluate existing training
  • Develop new training content
  • Deliver training to individuals or groups of employees.
Location: The lovely city of Raleigh, NC

Job Requirements

  • Bachelors degree in Organizational Development or Human Resources with an emphasis in Training and Development
  • Minimum of 10 years demonstrated expertise in the development and delivery of training programs and services
  • Must have a strong HR background
  • Must have presentation skills that leverage influence
  • Background in managing Training Projects
  • Ability of problem solving and critical thinking
  • Demonstrated ability to lead classroom instruction, facilitate workshops in a classroom setting as well as virtual
  • Demonstrated knowledge of adult learning principles, Instructional design
  • Demonstrated project leadership skills to manage complex projects and to
  • Ability to develop innovative, creative ideas addressing training related problems, concerns and programs
  • Ability to analyze and apply new training methods and applications
  • Executive and management development experience, including consulting on organizational development, leadership development, change management and related strategies
  • Strong communication and presentation skills, both verbal and written
  • Proficiency in Microsoft applications is required (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook)
TO APPLY: Email resume to[Click Here to Email Your Resum]ORcindyATaustinallenDOTcomin MS Word or PDF(please remove the capital letters and replace with proper symbols). **Resumes sent with a link to an Online resume or a video resume will not be considered.** All Interview, relocation, & fee expenses paid by companies. Excellent compensation packages, benefits, perks, and generous relocation packages. Some Facts You Should Know About Austin-Allen Company... *Successfully recruiting professionals since 1973. *One of the most successful firms in the U.S. We consistently rank in the top percentile of a large national network of Technical Recruiters. *Many of our staff are national award winning consultants with years experience and are C.P.C.s (Certified Personnel Consultants). Areas of Specialization... * Engineering * Six Sigma Black Belts * Accounting * Distribution * Human Resources * Materials / Purchasing * Quality Engineers & Managers * Manufacturing Management Stay current with our blog atwww.austinallen.com/blog/
