item.title: Trainer - Presenter - Speaker - Consultant - Education - Teacher
item.dc:creator: Subway
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Trainer - Presenter - Speaker - Consultant - Education - TeacherSeeking trainers for our highly successful research-based school program: MOTIVATING UNMOTIVATED STUDENTS: ENGAGEMENT AND MOTIVATION IN EVERY CLASSROOM USING DIFFERENTIATED INSTRUCTION (DI) STRATEGIES You will train other teachers using our copyrighted and highly successful evidence-based programs. We are the Center for Teacher Effectiveness and we train largely in PK 12 grade public schools and charter schools and at universities nationwide. A smaller number of our trainers train at boys and girls clubs, military (DOD) schools, as well as at churches and private and Christian schools. We are seeking teachers / trainers / presenters / and consultants to join our team. You have the choice to remain in your current position and train for us on off days or train for us on a more robust basis. You can work in your local area, regional area, or nationally and travel to work in other states (you determine). Our training (hopefully your training) helps make extraordinary teachers. Our presentation (hopefully your presentation) is proven to help teachers, students, and schools succeed together on a level they never thought possible. We have and immense amount of school success data and we are eager to share it with you. Click on the link immediately below to view school success data from Dr. Johnny Alvarado, an administrator with the Fresno County Office of Education. These are the kind of results we are known for (and hopefully you will be known for if you join our team)! https://www.filesanywhere.com/fs/v.aspx?v=8b6f65875c616fbd739c. We do NOT pay hourly. Our trainers usually earn $1000 - $3500 per training day. None of our trainers earn less than $1000 per training day and often much more. If your passion to present is strong and you believe your presentation style would be equally strong; and if you have demonstrated the art of presenting / training / teaching / and leading exceedingly well, then we are interested in you. If you possess the qualities of a "Top Tier" professional, please follow the steps BELOW in this post to apply to our elite team. If you: Are a real 'teachers' teacher' or school leader (you are good at what you do) Or, are an impeccably professional trainer / consultant / speaker / presenter Love leading, teaching, and speaking - and are good at all three Have an entrepreneurial spirit Then we: Will invite you to join our team of esteemed instructors Will train you to become an elite regional or national teacher/trainer for our firm Will help you achieve all of your personal and professional goals What types of professionals are we seeking? Certified educators of all job types and grade levels but we do have a small number of trainers who are not certified. It is beneficial to have a background in the education field or close ties/a connection with PK - 12 education. If you are not certified but have a close connection working with children and enjoy training adults then you will be considered. We also seek university professors, seasoned speakers, and trainers from all backgrounds and currently successful consultants. For illustrative purposes, successful consultants who work with us have the following backgrounds: teachers, principals, counselors, professors, assistant principals, superintendents, retired educators, social workers, behavior specialist, staff development coordinators, professional speakers and consultants, authors, plus other backgrounds dealing with students. We also have a few trainers that have worked training adults in other areas (e.g. in prison settings) and also those that are speakers for other companies. By the way, if you are a retired educator (or retired trainer) we are interested and hope you consider our offer because your experience is invaluable! Our trainers are highly qualified and can hold the attention and deliver a message to an audience. You MUST enjoy training and staff development. If you are interested in learning more about our company, beliefs, financials, etc., we request that you reply to this posting with a resume or brief describing your background and your connection with students/schools. WE WILL MEET THIS SUMMER APPLICANTS WHO MEET OUR REQUIREMENTS WILL BE INVITED TO ATTEND OUR NEXT 4-DAY TRAIN-THE-TRAINER SESSION. Orlando, FL- July 10-13, 2017 Our nationally recognized instructors teach innovative and highly effective discipline and differentiation strategies at seminars and education conferences, in schools and districts, and are helping teachers everywhere! You will find our seminars to be a breath of fresh air. Our active duty K-12 teacher-trainers live in the trenches on a daily basis and pride themselves in successfully using the research based strategies they teach to you in their own classrooms. You will receive highly practical and proven strategies which can be immediately implemented when you return to your classroom. Teachers and administrators who evaluate our training say that we are redefining teaching and learning in schools by providing powerful, easy-to-use, teacher friendly strategies that immediately improve classroom behavior and that help teachers address diverse learning needs to promote motivation and a desire to learn in all.

Job Requirements

* All consultants and trainers for our company attend a train-the-trainer session prior to training at schools this is required. Our train-the-trainer trainings are always 4 FULL days. We seek exemplary teachers and administrators who serve children, parents, and teachers honorably and with great commitment. Like you, we are also a highly regarded. Our strong corporation enjoys a sterling reputation with teachers, schools, and districts all around the United States and in other countries! Our educational roots run deep. Components of our program were initially developed with the help and guidance of Dr. Madeline Hunter and Coach John Wooden, both from UCLA. Yes, thats right, Coach John Wooden Integrity means much to us. We are calling for accomplished teachers and administrators to help us meet an ever-growing training demand. We seek you because we need the very best to help us train in schools and districts and at education conferences everywhere. We are hoping you are that teacher or administrator. You don't know if you qualify? Here is how to tell: Do you possess our "three P's?" Personality. Do you have the personality to deliver content in a way that will engage, entertain, move, and inspire your audience? We will give you the content that will make you shine, but can you DELIVER the message? Professionalism. Are you the teacher, administrator, speaker, presenter, or professional that others admire? Are you the one that others come to for advice because you care and you are good! Passion. The most important "P." Even more than a yearning to earn a big paycheck, do you have an overriding passion to improve education and help teachers and children succeed like never before? If you answered no to any of the three questions above, we are not the right company for you. If your passion is just a big paycheck we will not work well together. If, however, your passion is to help improve teaching and learning BUT you dont mind receiving handsome pay for doing just that, then we want to talk with you immediately! Your first step will be to evaluate us and to do this you will access our website to learn about our heritage, history, and our beliefs, as well as view some of our school success data. If you believe you would make a "Top Tier" presenter, copy and pastethe link to your web browser and learn more about this opportunity! http://www.ditrainer.com/directors/rick-dahlgren (follow the steps on our CEOs page). We are prepared to offer the finest teacher, speaker, consultant, or administrator a professional and financial opportunity of a lifetime. An opportunity that comes with pay unmatched, even in the corporate world. Several additional thoughts: **** Check this out today. You will be glad you did and we want to meet you! **** Retired and retiring teachers and administrators or leaders are also strongly encouraged to apply. **** If this opportunity does not fit you but you know an impeccable professional who would be a great trainer for us would you kindly forward this message to that professional? **** In the event you believe this may be "too good to be true," we are immediately prepared to have you speak with "active duty" classroom teachers and principals who have been training for us for many years and in some cases close to two decades! Thank you for reviewing our information - we wish you the best as you endeavor to help teachers and students succeed!

item.title: Education, Training & Communications Manager
item.dc:creator: DHL
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Job Description Even if youre not familiar with our name, youve almost certainly heard of our billion-dollar brands like Cadbury, Milka, Prince and Oreo. Developing the worlds favorite snacks, were passionate about creating delicious moments of joy for people all around the world.Working at Mondelz International is all about the power of big - and small. Why big? Because were the worlds leading maker of Chocolate, Biscuits, Candy and Gum. Were ranked #1 in chocolate, biscuits and candy, and #2 in gum. Whats more, we employ over 100,000 people worldwide and market products in around 165 countries. Why small? We go out of our way to hear everyones point of view, and develop local roots wherever we go. Its this combination of big and small that drives everything we do. For more information, please visit: http://www.mondelezinternational.com/ and www.facebook.com/mondelezinternational. Human Resources

With more than nearly 100,000 employees around the world, we need to make our size work for us. Your human resources skills can help make that happen. Youll partner with business units to create growth opportunities for our talent, building the right enterprise capabilities and, ultimately, a culture that enables us to be competitive and also fun.

The Education, Training & Communications Manager is responsible for leading the overall training and organization development activitiesfor the plant. Responsible for the effectiveness and efficiency of training, leadership development,organization design and development and feedback systems for exempt, non-exempt and hourly. This positionwill also lead the IL6S Education and Training Pillar team and working with AM and PM pillars to develop, communicate and implement training systems across the plant. In this role the incumbent will be responsiblefor the skill assessment and certification process, developing and documenting training programs, developingtrainer identification and certification process, and building training facilities within the plant to support both self-directed learning and knowledge transfer processes. This roles works to engrain a learning culturein the plant aligned with High Performance Work System concepts.

Primary Responsibilities/Accountabilities:

Manages the Education & Training Pillar (OPL, Skills Matrix, etc.).

Leads the Integrated Lean Six Sigma (IL6S) Education and Training Pillar ensuring objectives for Phase1 through 4 are fully implemented and sustainable

Participates as a member of the Regional Education and Training pillar, networks with other sites todetermine current best practices and share learnings.

Serve as primary lead with Line of the Future training coordination, transference of materialsthroughout remainder of facility, and network with other sites to provide guidance and strategiesidentified and successfully executed.

Manage execution and quality delivery of change across the programs assigned to this role incorporating everything from the initial change impact assessment and stakeholder alignment through to delivery of training,

communications and other change interventions to help achieve our desired change outcomes.

Ensure program leadership provide change sponsorship as required

Oversee, co-ordinate and provide thought-leadership to project team colleagues supporting the change initiative.

Establish and measure change KPIs for the program.

Create consistency in key messages between projects, as appropriate, and deliver high-quality direction to end users.

Manage site communications, including development of a communication strategy & execution model.

Be an active member of the plant team; sharing learning, expertise and coaching to develop others.

Proactively use involvement in programs to build change ability across teams to help drive our overall change capabilitybuilding strategy; this will be done through modeling appropriate change behaviors and actively engaging program teams in the change management process.

Establish, coordinate and monitor the annual training plan objective for hourly and salaried personnel.

Conducts and facilitates internal plant training initiatives. Coordinate with Region support for corporate initiatives.

Coordinate the efficient use of training, training materials and Organization Development expertise/resources withinthe plant.

Supports Quality, Safety and HR in site training requirements.

Guide and execute the Leadership Development process across the plant.

Manages and Coordinates the Hourly Training Programs including OJT to determine effectiveness.

Assure required training is flagged and scheduled when required.

Ensure strategic initiatives include effective change management strategies.

Qualifications
  • BS/BA in Business Administration, Human Resources or related field.
  • Broad education and experience with the emphasis in Business Administration, Business Management or related fields is required.
  • The position requires executive ability to direct the activities of other.
  • Excellent Communication Skills (Written & Oral) ability to assist managers in writing logical, well thought out disciplinary memos and performance plans.
  • 5 or more years of training experience is required
  • Experience in a unionized facility is required
  • One year of experience with IL6S
  • Knowledge of company products, processes, policies and operating procedures is required.
Mondelz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance.
Applicants must complete all required steps in the application process, including providing a Resume/CV, in order to be considered for this position.

item.title: Training (Paid) | Communications , HR, Business Administration
item.dc:creator: Subway
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Immediate Start in Communications & Sales: Graduate & Gap Year Applications Encouraged Are you a recent Graduate looking to get your career started? Then AC Communications could be the place for you! Looking for 15+ Graduates who have a passion for Sale, Customer Service, Marketing, Promotions and Events, and brand awareness Graduates are encouraged to apply, however, full product training is also provided.
Sales and customer satisfaction are a major part of any service based business. Customers determine the size and strength of a business and even its longevity. Thats why in this economy our client representatives are in such high demand. Weve proven ourselves to be the best, most reliable source of new customer acquisition for our current clients throughout the USA. This is a perfect opportunity for a recent graduate looking to get their foot in the door! ABOUT US: AC Communications specializes in consulting and new customer acquisition through face to face interactions with prospective customers. We act as a compliment to our clients traditional forms of mass media marketing with a direct approach that produces new, profitable customers on a daily basis. As a result of our continuous efforts, our clients experience increased market share and, more importantly, increased revenue. In fact, we have been so successful that theyre now looking for us to double in size.

Job Requirements

IF YOU HAVE WORKED WITH CUSTOMERS IN THE PAST AND YOU ENJOY INTERACTING WITH PEOPLE, WE MAY HOLD THE KEY TO YOUR FUTURE...
During your career at AC Communications, you will put your customer service skills to use on a daily basis by explaining the benefits of our clients services to their targeted audience. You will also learn to answer customers' queries, handle objections, and complete new customer acquisitions during face to face presentations. And, when interacting with existing customers, you will provide basic customer service and direction whenever possible. Advancement opportunities will be available for those ambitious people looking to maximize their potential. We welcome newcomers to the business world, graduates, and anyone with customer service or business related experience. We provide all necessary tools and campaign materials, so no specific degree or qualifications are necessary?
IF YOU'RE EXCITED ABOUT LEARNING IN A FUN, DRIVEN ENVIRONMENT, WE WOULD LOVE TO HEAR FROM YOU!
All applicants must be at least 18 years of age and able to work both independently and with others. Our representation techniques involve B2B and B2C so you will need to have strong communications skills and be willing to expand your comfort zones. Top performers will also receive occasional financial rewards, incentives, and travel allowances, so if youre excited about a new opportunity, wed love to meet you! PLEASE SEND US YOUR RESUME TODAY FOR IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION!

item.title: SVP Enterprise Architecture
item.dc:creator: Levis
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

One of top clients is continuing to invest in their team and expand their leadership. They are currently seeking a Senior Vice President ofEnterprise Architecture (EA). In this role, you will be the most senior architecture manager in the company and will be responsible for managing the overall IT architecture by developing and maintaining a holistic, long term view of all systems and technologies to support our clients technology strategy. This role will help drive the technology vision for the enterprise to support integrated experiences for clients and colleagues and to support an efficient operating environment. This managerial role will be responsible for developing a high performing and effective team which includes setting strategic direction with responsibility for people, budget, and outcomes. The major initial focus of the role will include conducting strategic planning activities for the information systems landscape, and communicate the outcomes in terms of future-state architectures, strategies and roadmaps. Focus will be primarily on software application architecture, with a secondary understanding of the physical infrastructure. Basic Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's degree required
  • Minimum 15 years of experience in an architecture role required
  • Minimum 10 years of managerial experience required

Job Requirements

Skills and Knowledge:
  • Strong knowledge of Enterprise Architecture concepts and frameworks including TOGAF and Zachman or similar TOGAF certification is a plus.
  • Knowledge of IT Infrastructure library (ITIL) principles and practices.
  • Must have strong verbal and written communication skills as well as strong managerial and interpersonal skills.
  • Experienced influencing (ultimately to enforce) architecture disciplines and standards and persuasive in pushing forward new, standardized and innovative technologies and methods.
  • Pragmatic, with an ability to identify, prioritize and weigh different options and recommend constructive solutions; has a successful track record of maintaining a big-picture view while making progress in small steps.
  • Senior level experience including advising, influencing and developing solution architectures in complex organizations with heterogeneous technology environments.
  • Ideal candidate will have experience developing target architectures and roadmaps which influence IT and business direction.
  • Ability to identify and collaboratively select IT solutions to business problems.
  • Strong project management skills.
  • Familiarity with Architecture governance including chairing design authorities, setting and communicating IT standards, EA tools, and maintaining shared knowledge repositories etc.
  • Strong analytical skills with an ability to map business vision to strategy.
  • At least 5 years of banking or financial services experience preferred.
  • Master's degree preferred.
  • Responsible and accountable for appropriate quality controls related to the financial products client provides, the services they deliver, the processes they employ, and the incentives with which they reward their colleagues.
  • Ensure that all client products, financial solutions and services are provided ethically and with integrity in a manner that is consistent with the client-first culture and values embodied in clients PRIDE statement
Compensation is based on candidates history and experience level, but is highly competitive along with a very generous bonus of 25% of base compensation. Relocation assistance for non-local candidates is a potential option.

item.title: Construction Field Superintendent
item.dc:creator: DHL
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Smart Build Capitalis seeking a highly-motivated & professionalConstructionField Superintendentto join our incredibly fast growing construction team inOrlando! As a key member of our building team, the Construction Field Superintendent will be expected to run day-to-day operations on the construction site and control the short-term schedule. They will be responsible for all aspects of the home building process and will be expected to:
  • Maintain high standards of quality throughout the building process including craftsmanship, assembly, safety, and cleanliness
  • Maintain schedules with diligent project and time management
  • Understand the scope of work for each vendor

Job Requirements

Required Skills and Abilities of the Construction Field Superintendent:
  • Excellent project management and time-management skills
  • Strong leadership, communication, interpersonal, and customer service skills
  • Demonstrated knowledge of new home construction process, scheduling and cost control procedures.
  • Highly knowledgeable in local, state and federal building and construction codes; OSHA and EPA guidelines
  • Ability to read and comprehend detailed construction blueprints, specifications, and detailed development drawings
  • Basic technology skills, including Microsoft Windows, Outlook, and residential production scheduling system
Experience/Education:
  • Experience in Production Homebuilding environment, MINIMUM 3 YEARS
  • Construction Related College Degree, High School Diploma or GED, or equivalent experience
Other Requirements:
  • Minimal travel required; must own or lease a truck and have a valid drivers license with insurance coverage
  • Cell phone with data package
We are an equal opportunity employer. To be considered for this role please reply to this ad with a copy of your resume. Must be able to start work within 2 weeks of employment offer acceptance.

item.title: Private Equity Accountant
item.dc:creator: Google
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Private Equity Accountant Prestigious Private Equity firm seeking several highly motivated private accountant accountants with outstanding skills for their NJ office. Responsibilities Include:
  • Maintain all financial data in the investment database
  • Post all journal entries and prepare monthly trial balance reports
  • Reconcile all cash received from investors and investments
  • Reconcile bank accounts
  • Calculate capital calls and distributions
  • Allocate income to partners in accordance with terms of partnership agreements
  • Prepare and issue quarterly financial statements, in accordance with US GAAP for each entity
  • Maintain and update investment data (number of shares, location of securities, country of origin)
  • Interact with clients and provide information as needed

Job Requirements

  • Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance or Economics
  • CPA and/or MBA are strong pluses
  • 2+ years related experience in fund accounting within the Private Equity field
  • Strong knowledge of Bloomberg, financial reporting and financial products (ie: equities, futures, fixed income)

item.title: Chief Executive Officer (CEO) at Ennis Regional Medical Center and Parkview Regional Hospital
item.dc:creator: Envato
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Job Summary The CEO provides leadership and direction for the overall operation of the hospital. Plans, directs and coordinates the development of short and long range objectives; is responsible for achieving the organizations financial and non-financial goals. General Responsibilities
  • Coordinates the activities of senior executives and works with them to develop short and long range objectives, policies, and procedures.
  • Ensures that policies are uniformly understood and consistently interpreted and administered.
  • Establishes the organization hierarchy and delegates limits of authority to subordinates executives; prescribes the specific limitations of the authority of subordinates regarding policies, contractual commitments, expenditures and personal actions.
  • Reviews and approves all financial reports, budgets, managed care contracts and major expenditures; directs, establishes, reviews, and adjusts charges for services; and maintains accreditation and licensure standards of the Joint Commission on Accreditation of Hospital Organizations, Medicare, Medicaid, state licensure, regulatory agencies, and similar organizations.
  • Analyzes operating results of the organization and its principal components relative to established objectives and ensures that appropriate steps are taken to correct unsatisfactory conditions.

Job Requirements

Minimum Qualifications (Experience, Education and Special Certifications)
  • Master's Degree in Hospital Administration (MHA), Business Administration (MBA), Management or related field is required.
  • A minimum of 3-5 years experience at the CEO level in a similar sized for-profit, acute-care hospital is required; however, may also consider 3-5 years of COO experience in a larger, for-profit, acute-care hospital.
  • Exceptional physician recruitment and relations skills are required.
  • Exceptional community and board relations skills are required.
  • Exceptional leadership skills and a hands-on visible approach to staff management and interaction are required.
  • Exceptional financial acumen and operations management expertise are required.
PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORKING CONDITIONS - The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Requires prolonged sitting and some bending, stooping, and stretching. Requires eye-hand coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to operate a keyboard, photocopier, telephone, calculator, and other office equipment. Requires normal range of hearing and eyesight to record, prepare, and communicate appropriate reports. Requires lifting papers or boxes up to 50 pounds occasionally. Work is performed in an office environment and involves frequent contact with staff and the public. LifePoint Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled LifePoint Health and all of our facilities are committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunity for all applicants and employees and complies with all applicable laws prohibiting discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of color, race, sex, age, religion, national origin, disability, genetic information, gender identity, sexual orientation, veterans status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. This job description in no way states or implies that the key accountabilities above are the only ones being performed by the individual(s) with this job description. The individual(s) may be called upon and required to follow or perform other duties and tasks requested by his or her supervisor, consistent with the purpose of the position, department and/or company objectives.

item.title: Territory Sales - Construction Equipment
item.dc:creator: DHL
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Territory Sales Rep - Construction Equipment Industry - Portland, OR - $100k
  • Our client, a strong regional leader in the construction equipment industry, has an immediate need for a skilled Territory Sales Rep for theirPortland, ORterritory.
  • This company is very much of an industry leader, representing a wide variety of construction equipment, both sales and rental. This is a strong regional company that has been serving the construction market in the area for over 50 years, and has built a strong reputation for providing great products and excellent service to their customer base.
  • In this Territory Sales role, this candidate will take over a very well performing territory from the existing Rep who is moving out of the region. As such, this will be a fantastic opportunity to come in, learn the client base, and be set up for almost immediate success as those clients and commissions will transfer to this incoming Rep. The first year potential income in this role is $100k+. In addition to taking over existing accounts, this Territory Sales Rep will also work to develop new prospects and maximize revenues from existing accounts. This role will call on construction companies and construction job sites.
  • The company has a branch location in Portland, OR, and much of the client base is within a 30 mile radius of this location. Our client is looking for someone that can work this territory independently, while receiving fantastic support from the rest of the internal team.
  • Compensation for this position includes a strong base salary and lucrative commission plan that will put yourtotal first year income around $100k. Outside of that, the company offers acompany truck (Ford F150), gas card, client expense account, cell phone, laptop, and comprehensive benefits package that will include Health, Dental, Vision, Generous PTO, Paid Holidays, 401(k) match, and much more.
  • Requirements for this position include 3-5 years of outside sales experience, ideally in the construction industry, or a related field. A college degree is a plus, but is not required for this position.
#FindYourPath #StepYourJobUp #SalesCareers Sales Advice, Tips, Pointers

Job Requirements

Requirements for this position include 3-5 years of outside sales experience, ideally in the construction industry, or a related field. A college degree is a plus, but is not required for this position.

item.title: CEO River Crest Hospital Behavioral Health
item.dc:creator: FedEx
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Universal Health Services, Inc. (UHS) knows what it takes to lead, inspire and succeed. One of the nations largest and most respected hospital companies, UHS owns and operates through its subsidiaries acute care hospitals, behavioral health facilities and ambulatory centers in the United States, Puerto Rico, the U.S. Virgin Islands and the United Kingdom. UHS built an impressive record of achievement and performance, steadily growing from a startup company with zero revenue into a Fortune 500 corporation with annual revenue that exceeds $9 billion. The company's operating philosophy has proven to be effective: Build or acquire high quality hospitals in rapidly growing markets, then invest in the people and equipment needed to allow each facility to thrive and become a dominant healthcare provider in its community. Headquartered in King of Prussia, PA, UHS ranks on the Fortune 500 list of America's largest corporations with over 74,000 employees, and is consistently listed among Fortune's "Most Admired Companies and one of the 30 Most Meaningful Companies To Work For in America by Business Insider. Chief Executive Officer RiverCrest Hospital River Crest Hospital is a modern 80-bed acute care hospital, specializing in the treatment of mental health and substance abuse issues that can afflict persons of all ages, from children and adolescents to adults and the elderly. Our continuum of care includes evaluation, crisis stabilization, treatment, education, prevention, and aftercare. River Crest Hospital is an acute facility that is accredited by The Joint Commission. Our goal is threefold: to provide crisis stabilization, skills development, and enhancement of personal strengths so you may function safely in health after you leave our program. River Crests safe, friendly atmosphere and highly trained, staff work together to speed recovery for you or your loved one. We never forget we provide care and comfort to fellow human beings in need. River Crest patients receive respectful and dignified treatment from all our people at all times while they are at our acute care facility. To learn more visit: http://www.rivercresthospit al.com/ River Crest Hospital is currently seeking a dynamic Behavioral Health Executive with a proven track record providing services in a for profit Behavioral Health Hospital/Residential Treatment Program or has managed a large Psychiatric/Behavioral Health department within a large Acute care Hospital. Candidates must show a strong employment history with progressive growth throughout their career. The ideal CEO candidate will be responsible for directing the day-to-day operations, managing and developing staff, assuring high quality care, sound fiscal operations, maintaining a strong referral base and compliance with Joint Commission and CMS regulations while continually monitoring the facility's services and delivery systems. Job Duties/Responsibilities: Accountable for creating an environment and culture that focuses on fulfilling the organizations mission, vision and values. Operational management of clinical and non-clinical departments including but not limited to: Nursing, Admissions, Business Development, Process Improvement, Finance, Clinical Services, Regulatory Affairs that effectively drive patient care outcomes Ensure hospital quality metrics are achieved through sound clinical processes following accreditation and regulatory agency guidelines. Recruit physicians and staff in targeted specialty areas, coordinate medical staff participation in new hospital ventures and targets, develop new areas of medical care to offer at the hospital. Supervise the development of more comprehensive outpatient care and ambulatory programs. Develop positive relationships with local industry, local government, potential key health care providers, and the general public. Ensure the timely submission of month-end financial and operational reviews, contribute to the development of and participation in corporate-wide strategic planning efforts. Communicate circumstances and events of operations to supervisor and other appropriate people to keep all apprised. Achieve budgeted financial objectives. Effectively manage contract negotiations and compliance with the commercial payor community. Increase revenues and income before inter-company allocations, maintain or decrease the effective bad debt rate, achieve the margin percentage, and implement operating cost controls in the areas of staffing, supplies, purchased services, etc. Focus on census building efforts and strategic planning.

Job Requirements

Requirements: Bachelor's Degree required, Master's Degree is preferred Currently working as a behavioral executive, i.e CEO at a Behavioral Health facility or as a Director of a large acute care facility with a large multi-unit psych department. A working knowledge of behavioral health management practices and clinical operations. An advanced knowledge of state and federal regulatory and various accreditation requirements related to behavioral health management. Working knowledge of operations and financial management and marketing methods. Ability to travel a minimum of 10% of the time. This opportunity offers the following: Challenging and rewarding work environment Growth and development opportunities within UHS and its subsidiaries Competitive Compensation Excellent Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Drug Plan 401k plan with company match Generous Paid Time Off Relocation benefits Bonus opportunity Car Allowance UHS is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at UHS via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of UHS. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by UHS as a result of the referral or through other means. *UHS is a registered trademark of UHS of Delaware, Inc., the management company for Universal Health Services, Inc. and a wholly-owned subsidiary of Universal Health Services, Inc. Universal Health Services, Inc. is a holding company and operates through its subsidiaries including its management company, UHS of Delaware, Inc. All healthcare and management operations are conducted by subsidiaries of Universal Health Services, Inc. To the extent any reference to "UHS or UHS facilities" on this website including any statements, articles or other publications contained herein relates to our healthcare or management operations it is referring to Universal Health Services' subsidiaries including UHS of Delaware. Further, the terms "we," "us," "our" or "the company" in such context similarly refer to the operations of Universal Health Services' subsidiaries including UHS of Delaware. Any employment referenced in this website is not with Universal Health Services, Inc. but solely with one of its subsidiaries including but not limited to UHS of Delaware, Inc.

item.title: CEO - Hospital - Mechanicsburg, PA
item.dc:creator: DHL
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

HealthSouth Rehabilitation Hospital of Mechanicsburg is currently looking for a Chief Executive Officer to join our hospital leadership team. HealthSouth Rehabilitation Hospital of Mechanicsburg isa 75-bed inpatient rehabilitation hospital that offers comprehensiveinpatientandoutpatientrehabilitation services designed to return patients to leading active and independent lives. LOCATION: 175 Lancaster Blvd., Mechanicsburg, PA 17055 Clickherefor a map to our location. The Chief Executive Officer is responsible for all day-to-day operations of the Hospital. This position is accountable for planning organizing and directing the hospital to ensure that quality patient care is provided and that the financial integrity of the hospital is maintained. The CEO ensures compliance with applicable laws and regulations as well as all policies and procedures set forth by the Governing Board and Medical Staff, and those required by Joint Commission standards.The CEO is responsible for creating an environment and culture that enables the hospital to fulfill its mission by meeting or exceeding its goals, conveying the hospital mission to all staff, holding staff accountable for performance, motivating staff to improve performance, recognize and reward performance, and being responsible for the operation of measurement, assessment and improvement of the hospital's performance. Job Code: 100186

Job Requirements

Total Education, Vocational Training and Experience: - Master's Degree in Business Administration, Healthcare Administration, or related healthcare field preferred. - Bachelor's degree with equivalent work experience of a Master's degree as demonstrated by such responsibilities as but not limited to accountability for hospital operations, budget development, analysis and oversight; marketing including volume growth/program development; FTE management; expense control; policy and procedure development and implementation; and process development to facilitate regulatory compliance. - Five years of management experience in healthcare. Minimum 2-3 years in Senior Management position. Machines, Equipment Used:- General office equipment such as telephone, copy machine, fax machine, calculator, computer.Physical Requirements: - Good visual acuity and ability to communicate.- Ability to lift a minimum of 20 pounds and ability push/pull a minimum of 30 pounds, which includes the lifting, pushing and/or pulling of medical supplies and equipment and the transferring and repositioning of patients. Reasonable assistance may be requested when lifting, pushing, and/or pulling are undertaken which exceeds these minimum requirements.Compliance:- Adheres to the company's Standards of Business Conduct.- Maintains current licensure and/or certifications, if applicable.Skills and Abilities:- Ability to speak, read, write, and communicate effectively.- Ability to coordinate, analyze, observe, make decisions, and meet deadlines in a detail-oriented manner.- Ability to work independently without supervision.Environmental Conditions:- Indoor, temperature controlled, smoke-free environment. Occasional outdoor exposure.- Exposure or potential exposure to blood and body fluids may be required.- Handicapped accessible.- May work under stressful circumstances at times.Proficiency or Productivity Standards:- Meets established attendance standards.- Adheres to hospital/department dress code including wearing ID badge.- May be required to work weekdays and/or weekends, evenings and or night shifts if needed to meet deadlines. - May be required to work on religious and/or legal holidays on scheduled days/shifts.- Will be required to work as necessary during disaster situations, i.e., before, during or after a disaster.- May be required to stay after workday to assist after a disaster situation until relief arrives.- May be required to perform other duties as assigned by supervisor.

item.title: Loan Document Specialist
item.dc:creator: Envato
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Loan Document Specialist
Loan Operations
Meadows Bank, Las Vegas <<<MORTGAGE EXPERIENCE DOES NOT QUALIFY>>>
Manager: Susan Hescher Days and Hours: M-F / 8:00-5:00
Location: Main Branch Classification: Non-Exempt
Job Summary: The main function of this job is to review and document consumer and commercial loans in accordance with bank policies and procedures. Position is responsible in the review of loan documents and assemble package(s) for completion; review imaged documents and other loan docs produced; balance daily/weekly Asset Liability GL; update ticklers; assist lenders with bank loans to include the coordination of the execution of agreement, closing documents and disbursement with bank; process UCC filings; consistent review and maintenance of loan files; provide a range of customer service functions at the financial institutions that assist in the creation and maintenance of long term client relationships; provide backup support as needed in receipt of loan packages for boarding and print billing statements.   Qualifications:
  • Position requires a High School Diploma or equivalent. Five (5) years of banking experience and two (2) years of Commercial Loan Servicing and Loan Documentation experience in the banking industry.
  • Ability to prioritize and multi-task.
  • Extensive knowledge of Excel, Word, Microsoft Office, Internet. Knowledge in Jack Henry and Laser Pro.
  • Requires the ability to exercise common sense and carry out detailed instructions, written and verbal.
  • Ability to compute and apply mathematical concepts.
  • Read and comprehend detailed instructions with the ability to write general correspondence.
  • Communicate effectively to small groups, clients, and fellow employees.
  • Able to work under tight time deadlines and handle pressure without sacrificing quality.
  • May be called upon from time to time to perform any job-related tasks as needed by the Bank.
  • Moderate daily telephone interaction and heavy daily email interaction with internal personnel.
 

Job Requirements

APPLICANTS MUST BE IN GOOD STANDING IN THEIR CURRENT DEPARTMENT. THE ESSENTIAL ELEMENTS OF THE POSITION REFLECT THE MAJOR DUTIES CONSIDERED NECESSARY TO DESCRIBE PRINCIPAL FUNCTIONS OF THE POSTION AND SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED AS A DETAILED DESCRIPTION OF ALL OF THE WORK REQUIREMENTS THAT MAY BE INHERENT IN THE POSITION. MEADOWS BANK EXPRESSLY RESERVES THE RIGHT TO CHANGE, MODIFY OR AMEND THE POSITION DESCRIPTION AND POSITION REQUIREMENTS AT ANY TIME.

item.title: Commercial Banking Market Leader
item.dc:creator: DHL
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Location 6831 Benjamin Franklin Drive, Columbia, MD 21046 About Us For 147 years, Sandy Spring Bank has provided outstanding financial services and remained committed to being a strong, local, independent bank. Our community offices throughout Maryland and Northern Virginia serve the unique needs of individuals, businesses and organizations every day. We are seeking competent, motivated employees who share our commitment to being remarkable. To attract and retain these quality individuals, we provide a market driven salary administration program and a comprehensive benefits package. Sandy Spring takes pride in offering a broad benefits program to its most valuable asset.our staff. About The Job Sandy Spring Bank is currently recruiting a Commercial Banking Market Leader. If you are the chosen candidate, you will be responsible for the day-to-day oversight and management of a specific market/division within the banks footprint. You will supervise and lead the following functions: Drive market commercial sales/portfolio goals; Coach and mentor team members; Develop and manage pre-determined annual budget; Serve as SSB spokesperson for Business Development and Community related events; Participate as an active member of multiple internal committees/councils (SLT, SLC and CX); Manage and facilitate the use of the CX360 system within the team; Oversee Advisory Board Meetings. The positions primary location will be located in Columbia, MD.

Job Requirements

Required Skills:
  • 5 to 7 years of broad experience in Commercial Banking.
  • Demonstrated success in developing and underwriting significant commercial businessand utilizing effective sales techniques.
  • Experience managing and leading others
  • Excellent written and oral communication
  • Expertise in analysis, interpretation and evaluation.
  • Presentation skills to complete sales presentations
  • Oversee the writing of complex proposals
  • Present pending loan packages
  • Provide coaching and guidance to employees
  • Maintain positive rapport with internal and external contacts. High level of independence needed to achieve strategic objectives.
Preferred Skills:  
  • Bachelors Degree
  • Thorough understanding of commercial banking concepts and practices
Compensation: We pay competitively to Market, and offer a 401(k) plan with employer match both pre-and post-tax contributions. We also offer an Employee Stock Purchase Plan along with the following benefits: * Free Banking, including discounts on loans * Paid Time Off * Tuition Assistance   In addition, for employees who work 30 hours per week: * Incentive opportunities * Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance *Paid Parental Leave * Life Insurance * Health Care and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts Sandy Spring Bank is an equal employment opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We maintain a drug-free workplace environment and perform pre-employment substance abuse testing.   If you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a position with Sandy Spring Bank, please call our job line at 1-800-399-5919 and select option 5. Requests are considered on a case-by-case basis.

item.title: Accountant (Construction Sector)
item.dc:creator: Envato
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Smart Build Capital LLC,a specialist in the building acquisition and construction of single family homes, condominiums & town homes across theOrlandoarea, is in urgent need of a full-time accounting & administrative support professional to join our team as anAccountant (Construction Sector).   In addition to helping us stay organized and on budget to better meet the growing building development demands of our customers, theAccountant (Construction Sector)will play an integral role in our construction firm to ensure the integrity of our accounting information by recording, verifying, consolidating and entering in transactions to help keep our books balanced! This administratively focusedfull-timeaccounting position will support the job costing, accounting and bookkeeping efforts of our diversified construction portfolio and under the direct supervision of the CFO and Accounting Manager, theAccountant (Construction Sector)will use their keen eye for detail & experience with accounting software (QuickBooks, Simply Accounting, Builders Trend, Microsoft Excel, Sage, Xero, etc.) to keep our financials organized and our construction business thriving! Key Responsibilities of the Accountant (Construction Sector):
  • Maintain and balance subsidiary accounts by verifying, allocating, recoding, posting, reconciling transactions, resolving discrepancies for all assets, liabilities, profits, losses, depreciation and other financial activities.
  • Assisting the CFO with financial status by collecting information; preparing balance sheet, profit and loss, financial reports, budget forecasts and other statements.
  • Maintain general ledger & manage job costing budgets
  • Protects organization's value by keeping information confidential.
  • Other accounting/administrative duties as required.

Job Requirements

Qualifications of the Accountant (Construction Sector):
  • College diploma in accounting or equivalent education. University Degree in accounting/finance is an asset.
  • 5+ years of experience working in a construction accounting or staff accountant position and/or in an accounting field preferred.
  • Proficient with Quick Books, AIA payments and other accounting systems with job costing modules.
  • Knowledge of and working experience with Builders Trend a definite asset.
  • Familiar with Inter-company transaction and reconciliations within QuickBooks.
  • Experienced with Balance Sheet reconciliations and sub ledger schedules.
  • Experience in working in an environment where the month end close is scheduled and must be finalized by the deadline.
  • Experienced in all areas of accounting - AP, AR, GL, PR , Balance Sheet & P&L
  • Able to communicate in English fluently.
  • Ability to research, manipulate and analyze data.
  • Excellent time management skills; ability to prioritize.
  • Ability to work under minimal supervision.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.
  • Effective analytical skills and interpersonal skills.
To Apply for the Accountant (Construction Sector) Role: Please click apply now and send us a copy of your resume for consideration. We are looking to hire immediately so you must be available to start work within 1-2 weeks from date of offer acceptance.

item.title: Real Estate Accountant
item.dc:creator: Envato
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

A long term established, rapidly growing real estate investment and management company is seeking a Property Accountant who will report directly to the Controller and be part of a team handling all aspects of property accounting and reporting for a mixed portfolioof commercial and housing properties. A large, national non-profit organization is seeking a Senior Real Estate Accountant to join its Finance team. Responsibilities:
  • Assist with preparation of annual operating and capital budgets and special project budgets working closely with Companys Property Managers and Controller
  • Prepare annual year-endwork papers for financials and tax return preparation for outside accountants
  • Review year-endjournal entries from outside accountants from tax returns and reconcile to the financial statements
  • Prepare monthly financial statements including balance sheet, profit and loss, and cash flow statements with supporting footnote disclosures
  • Assist with preparation of bank reconciliations on a monthly basis
  • Assist with monthly tenant billings
  • Record weekly and biweekly payroll as provided by payroll service
  • Review general ledger activity for completeness and accuracy
  • Prepare and record necessary monthly accruals and recurring journal entries
  • Prepare quarterly capex actual vs. budget
  • Prepare monthly payroll reconciliation for commercial property and management company
  • Assist with cash receipts
  • Review payroll reconciliation prepared by local student housing bookkeeper
  • Perform all tasks assigned effectively, efficiently, correctly andtimely
  • Work with the accounting software and its integrated property management component to facilitate the flow of financial and non-financialinformation into the system for each property
  • Prepare financial package(s) for lenders including operating statements, real estate owned schedules, and other schedules lenders may require
  • Special projects as needed

Job Requirements

  • Bachelors degree from accredited university in accounting
  • Between 2 and 4 years' experience in property accounting; student housing experience a plus
  • Public accounting experience a plus
  • Self-motivated,self-directed,and detailed oriented with ability to work without direct supervision
  • Desire to grow through career advancement displaying solid management abilities to lead and train future junior level employees
  • Strong oral and written communication skills and general ability to effectively communicate with direct supervisor and others
  • Knowledge of Real Page One Site Accounting and Leasing & Rents (or other major accounting system like MRI, YARDI, Skyline, etc) a plus , but not required
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook

item.title: Information Technology Manager
item.dc:creator: Google
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Denmark State Bank is seeking an experienced IT Manager to join its team. The position will be headquartered out ofthe Denmark, WI office. We are a well-established community bank with total assets of approximately $450 million, and we are headquartered just 15 minutes south of Green Bay in Denmark, Wisconsin. Denmark State Bank hassix full-service banking offices. Visitour website at www.denmarkstate.com for more information.   POSITION SUMMARY: Proactively plans and manages Banks automated information and telecommunications systems capability/services to protect the organizations data information and assets. Plans architecture of the Banks information resources and promotes information technology throughout the Bank including proactive development. Acts as the Banks Information Security Officer. Establishes and ensures implementation of policies and strategies to appropriately manage information resources to support strategic plan. Ensures information processing support entities perform to satisfaction of user community, management and professional standards. Evaluates complex technical proposals and interprets/negotiates technical and procedural issues on organization-wide projects.   PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: 1. Oversees all IT Technology infrastructure functions and systems. This includes, but is not limited to: hardware architecture, capacity management, systems security, systems integration, computer operations, hardware and network operations, telecommunications, systems documentation, user support, policy and procedure development, technical standards, schedules and project management. 2. Responsible for safeguarding Company data. Functions as Network Security Administrator providing oversight of policies and procedures regarding network access rights and responsibilities. Information security policy development and maintenance; design of security policy education, training and awareness activities and monitors compliance against industry standards. 3. Responsible for compliance with regulatory information technology regulations. Chairs the IT Steering Committee and Reports to the Board of Directors on a periodic basis regarding technology plans, audit activities, and other significant information technology related initiatives. Responsible for the collection, reporting and review of all required compliance data in response to an annual IT Examination by the banks outside examiners. 4. Responsible for establishing and managing a broad range of vendor relationships for the support of the technical aspects of the operational enterprise. Monitors the effectiveness and efficiency of the delivery of services through specifically defined service level agreement (SLAs) with the companys vendors. 5. Develops and updates the Companys Business Continuity Plan, including testing, backup/retrieval and security. 6. Oversees the acquisition, implementation and operation of information technology and communications systems including server hardware, workstations, printers, network equipment, wan and data/voice circuits. 7. Works with business unit managers to formulate a comprehensive Strategic Technology Plan that is consistent with the overall corporate objectives and budgetary considerations. Develops and monitors the Banks technology budget and capital expenditures.   SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: The position of IT Manager is responsible for the supervision of the Information Technology team and is required to demonstrate leadership and provide training and support to less experienced staff members. Supervisory responsibilities include assisting with interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.    

Job Requirements

ROLE QUALIFICATIONS:Minimum Education Bachelor of Science Degree in Computer Science and/or IT or equivalent technology related experience Minimum Experience 7 years work experience in all phases of computer operations 2 years directing employees in information technology environment 3 years experience in related area such as Network Administration Previous banking related experience strongly preferred Other Skills/Characteristics Strategic, big picture" focus Attention to detail Strong analytical/problem solving skills Ability to outline projects and convene resources to bear Strong project management skills with the ability to meet all deadlines and deliverables Ability to manage multiple priorities Good organizational skills User/practitioner of Internet-based services such as online banking, Bill pay, etc. to identify with bank/customer needs Service oriented focus with a strong sense of urgency Flexibility and adaptability Stays current on advancements in technology and in the banking industry, and makes recommendations to management and internal customers on appropriate technologies to meet organizational needs Collaborative skills Effective communication skills with the ability to influence others Works productively and effectively with outside vendors Ability to balance internal customer demands and needs with available resources Ability to work with confidential information Financial acumen to evaluate technology related budgets and capital expenditure requests Knowledge of and adherence to all appropriate regulatory and legal requirements Ability to meet individual goals, along with the ability to contribute in a team oriented environment to ensure departmental and organization wide goals are met The desire and ability to abide by our core values of: Exemplary Customer Service, People, Honest Communications, Integrity and Teamwork   Denmark State Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer

item.title: Account Executive - Management Training Program
item.dc:creator: YouTube
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Management Training Program - Full Time - Entry Level Are you dying to lead others and make decisions? Do you need to be in a full time, friendly culture where teamwork, competitiveness, ambition and strong social skills are the norms? Mercury Matrix, Inc is expanding rapidly and is looking for a highly-motivated candidate who has great communication skills, leadership qualities and who is confident that they can be groomed from an entry level sales associate to full time management in less than a year. Mercury has provided stability, support and a team focused environment for its staff. With our strategy of hiring people with untapped potential and developing them internally through our management training program from full time entry level sales representatives to full time managers.
Our Management Training Program focuses on peoples habits and provides training in the following areas: Communications & Sales: 4-8 weeks solely learning full time sales systems, client services and the ability to acquire new customers for our clients Training & Coaching: 8-16 weeks learning how to train others effectively, applying Situational Leadership and John Maxwell techniques Organizational Leadership: 8-16 weeks on public speaking, critical conversations, budgeting, goal setting, campaign and territory management
www.MercuryMatrixInc.com www.Instagram.com/MercuryMatrix www.YouTube.com/c/MercuryMatrixInc

Job Requirements

The Entry Level Account Executive position is a customer service and sales role. This position involves working directly with our Fortune 500 clients' customers, therefore, we are looking for candidates with the following experience:
  • 1 - 3 years Sales / Customer Service / Marketing Experience
  • 1 - 3+ years Coaching / Leadership Experience
  • 1+ years in a Competitive, Team Environment
  • Basic proficiency in Microsoft Office
  • Strong Work Ethic
  • Positive Attitude
  • Willingness to Learn
  • Outgoing Personality
  • Ability to Build Relationships with Customers and Coworkers
Preferred, but not required:
  • 1+ years leadership experience
  • Education or Experience in Marketing
Questions? Contact us at [Click Here to Email Your Resum] or call us at651-683-2665! About Us   Mercury Matrix, Inc.has expanded into the Twin Cities market because of constant client demands for our services. We are a privately owned sales and consulting firm that generates new accounts on behalf of Fortune 500 companies. We believe that if youre having fun then working hard is enjoyable. Our in depth, hands on training programs provides everyone the same opportunity to gain promotions, regardless of experience, background, and/or previous positions held. This position offers a compensation structure where pay is based upon individual performance. Our culture and working environment appeals to the more entrepreneurial mindset because we believe that if an individual can bring a great work ethic and student mentality to the table, then we will be able to train the basic skills necessary to have a successful career working with people. Learn more about our company atwww.mercurymatrixinc.com

item.title: Customer Service Agent - Call Center
item.dc:creator: Subway
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Customer Service Agent - Call Center
Customer Service Professionals with Insurance experience, are you ready to apply your expertise to bigger and more challenging projects? NESC may be just the partner youve been looking for. We are an industry-leading, full-service staffing agency, providing everything from skilled engineers to Warehouse/Manufacturing professionals for some of the nations largest industries, from Telecommunications, Defense and Aerospace to Pharmaceutical, Petrochemical, Biotech and many more. One of our top clients has immediate openings in their Customer Support operations. They are seeking 200+ Customer Service Agents to join their team! Positions are filling quickly so apply today. Our recruiters will work directly with you, getting to know your career needs and your skill sets so that we can connect you with just the right opportunities. Whether youre looking for part-time, contract or full-time positions, we maintain long-standing relationships with a wide range of top companies who are looking for candidates with your exact qualifications. Competitive wages offered depending on experience. In addition, candidates can earn exciting weeklyincentives through the on-site performance program! Call us to learn more about sign-on bonuses too! Let NESC work with you to help you build the career youve always wanted. Contact us todaywere looking forward to meeting you!
Customer Service Representative Call Center Accident and Health Agent Customer Service Agent Entry Level Insurance Agent Inside Sales
Call Center Job Summary As a Customer Service Agent you will be helping people nationwide with setting up their Health and Accident Insurance. You will be receiving inbound/outbound calls throughout your shift. Candidates that have experience with a License may be able to earn more hourly. The Customer Service Agent is the front line representative of the call center. This individual is responsible for handling inbound sales calls. The agent will review plan information and answer prospects questions regarding insurance options, with the goal of closing the sale by enrolling in coverage. The agent will be closely aware of call center policies, procedures and company/client goals and will strive to meet those goals. Agents must meet various productivity and quality levels established by their specific program. Customer service and/or sales experience, excellent communication skills, attention to detail, computer proficiency, and a process-orientation are paramount in an effective agent. Day to Day Responsibilities Include:
  • Educate and assist customers regarding the purchase of an insurance plan.
  • Complete a needs analysis to identify the best product for the customer. Goal is to determine best plan for the caller and enroll them in the plan of their choice.
  • Review plans and quote premiums.
  • Follow a call plan focused on sales and compliance.
  • Maintain schedule adherence (attendance, punctuality, use of AUX time)
  • Willingly accept and implement feedback to improve sales performance.
  • Adhere to all position-specific administrative policies, including but not limited to confidentiality, non-disclosure, and program-specific material usage.
Customer Service Representative Call Center Accident and Health Agent Customer Service Agent Entry Level Insurance Agent Inside Sales

Job Requirements

Requirements for Customer Service Agent: Working as a Call Center Agent, you must have excellent communication skills, both verbal and active listening skills. As the customer facing entity for our client, you must be able to represent the professional and knowledgeable qualities they are looking for. Additional Qualifications Include:
  • High school diploma / G.E.D
  • Current Accident and Health Insurance license (or desire to obtain)
  • Prior sales / customer service experience in a related environment (sales/service, call center preferred).
  • Assertive sales orientation. Have a passion for helping people through sales. Must possess the drive to close the sale.
  • Demonstrated strong process-orientation and attention to detail.
  • Demonstrated aptitude to learn, absorb, and actively use complex information.
  • Computer literacy. Ability to use multiple computer programs at one time.
Customer Service Representative Call Center Accident and Health Agent Customer Service Agent Entry Level Insurance Agent Inside Sales
NESCwe have the opportunities youre looking for!
Apply now!

item.title: Entry Level Manager - Training Provided - Full Time
item.dc:creator: Airbnb
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

New Opening: Entry Level Manager Position

No Management Experience Necessary - Entry Level Training Provided

Submit your resume for Entry Level Manager Position:

APPLY NOW!

Capstone Consultantsis now interviewing in Charlotte, NC for ourentry level manager positions, all of which have the opportunity for advancement within the company. We provide the opportunity for individuals with little to no experience to get their foot in the door to gain entry level training experience needed for their new career. Our hands on training approach allows us to cross-train candidates in entry level areas of: sales, marketing, management and leadership development. We are not hiring managers. We train the top performers into management! Currently Filling Entry Level Positionsin: Marketing and Sales Customer Service Account Management Entry level Management At Capstone, we manage all the face to face client interaction with new and existing customers. Our techniques consistently provide an effective marketing solution for our clients by increasing the revenue and customer base within their campaigns. We only promote from within our company and reward employees that earn the opportunity to advance into management. We will be expanding to 3 new markets in 2017.We want self-motivated people that are looking to advance their career into a management position that will oversee one of our new markets.
Submit your resume for Entry Level Manager Position: APPLY NOW! For immediate consideration contact HR at704-334-1700
 

Job Requirements

Capstone Consultantsprovides a great opportunity forrecent college graduatesor those looking to make achange in their career to a more stableposition with greater advancement opportunity. We want self-motivated people who value integrity, professionalism, team work and strong work ethic. Some of the top trainers and managers within our company have collegiate or professional sports backgrounds so a competitive mindset is a plus. Responsibilities include: Training in sales, marketing and management Working both independently and as part of the team Gaining experience in public speaking and presentations Training and Mentoring new account managers Bachelor degree is preferred-Internshipsareavailable for qualified students

item.title: Sales Consultant - Entry Level - Full Training
item.dc:creator: Subway
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Entry Level Sales Consultant/Full Time Account Manager Full Time - Entry Level - Sales and Marketing Opportunity

MAS International, a sales and marketing firm located in the Phoenix area, is seeking driven individuals with the desire to grow, advance, and build a career within our company. Job Description: The Junior Executive position offers a fun, energetic, and team oriented environment where individuals will be provided with a fun training program and will have the opportunity to advance accordingly based on performance. This position includes one to one sales based interaction with customers. Junior executives will be trained to interact and communicate with potential and existing customers as well as develop professional and personal managerial skills. This position offers a compensation structure where pay is based on individual performance Benefits:
  • Career Advancement Opportunity
  • Financial Rewards
  • Time off for Major Holidays
  • Training and Developmental Opportunities
  • Employee awards and recognition
  • Travel Opportunities
  • Wellness Programs - Sports Team Leagues
  • Weekly Office Night
Persons with Experience in the following areas should apply: Sales, Marketing, customer service, administrative assistant, manager, full time, retail, management, office, project manager, sports, insurance, real estate, car sales, education, training, customer service representative, entry level, restaurant.

Job Requirements

  • 4 year degree OR 2 years experience
  • Strong organizational skills
  • Self-motivatedand comfortable working both independently and as part of a team
  • Career oriented individual looking for a company with advancement opportunity
We are now striving to attract and train the most capable and skilled individuals to help us acquire new clients, grow into new markets, and develop new campaigns. Because this is an entry level position,sales training will be provided. We strictly promote from within which allows all employees room for advancement. This position offers a compensation structure where pay is based upon individual performance.

item.title: Coordinator - Continuing Education / Business and Industry Training
item.dc:creator: YouTube
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Gaston College Dallas, NC Campus Accepting applications forCoordinator - Continuing Education / Business and Industry Training Summary: Maintain and strengthen existing business and industry customized workforce development and training partnerships, and initiate new contacts to develop long-term partnerships in the defined service area. Identify and develop customized workforce development and continuing education programs and courses by conducting needs assessments. Coordinate the delivery of training courses and programs and monitor quality through systematic course and program review and evaluation. Assist in marketing and budget-related activities and management. Duties & Responsibilities:
  1. Maintain and strengthen existing business and industry customized workforce development and training partnerships. Initiate new contacts to develop long-term partnerships in Gaston and Lincoln counties.
  2. Schedule and facilitate meetings with existing business and industry clients and potential clients, other community colleges, business and industry consortiums, advisory committees, and related groups in support of business and industry training and continuing education.
  3. Identify and develop customized workforce development and continuing education courses and programs by conducting needs assessments. Write proposals and manage projects.
  4. Evaluate effectiveness of customized and other training/education and modify courses or programs to improve effectiveness.
  5. Design, develop, and oversee training course and program development, and coordinate the delivery (i.e., logistics) of training courses and programs. Assist with and deliver training as needed.
  6. Identify, interview, and recommend instructors for hire. Evaluate instructors and provide feedback and coaching as needed. Solve issues between clients and instructors.
  7. Assist the Vice President and Associate Vice President for Economic and Workforce Development, in collaboration with the Colleges marketing and public relations function, to develop and implement a marketing plan for business and industry and continuing education programs.
  8. Assist in preparing and managing applicable budgets and coordinate activities funded by sources such as Customized Training, Occupational Extension, and self-supporting courses and programs offered through the College's Continuing Education programs. Monitor the applicable budgets and expenditures, prepare fund proposals and requests as needed, and provide regular project updates as requested.
  9. Identify potential cost-effective, revenue-producing programs and services that the College could develop and suggest new ideas based on research and data.
  10. Participate in divisional, departmental, and College-wide meetings and committees, partner with other College departments as needed, and assist with researching, identifying, and writing grant proposals as needed.
  11. Maintain cooperative working relationship with students, co-workers, other organizations, and the public.
  12. Follow all policies and procedures of the College and for client locations, with specific attention given to safety-related rules and procedures.
  13. Perform other related duties incidental to the work herein described.
Minimum Education Qualifications:
  • Bachelors degree from a regionally accredited institution in business administration, adult education, or a related field required.
Minimum Experience Qualifications:
  • Three years experience coordinating the development and delivery of business and industry, continuing education, or adult education courses and programs required.
  • Knowledge of training/course design and experience facilitating training courses required.
  • Must possess the ability to work with minimal supervision but with multiple partners in a team environment and establish credibility and rapport with business clients and College staff.
  • Must possess the ability to coordinate and follow through on multiple projects and details.
  • Outstanding communication skills (i.e., listening, writing, and oral) and proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel required.
  • Manufacturing background preferred.
