item.title: Community Liaison/Business Development Professional
item.dc:creator: Envato
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Specializing in the treatment of Substance Abuse, Sexual Health and co-occurring Mental Health issues and their manifestations within our LGBTQ+ clients, Pride Institute offers a 42- bed inpatient/residential treatment program and a partial hospitalization program with lodging, both located in Eden Prairie, MN (a suburb of Minneapolis) and an intensive outpatient program in the Uptown area of Minneapolis.Our programs are designed to assist our LGBTQ+ clients, 18 years of age or older, in developing the knowledge, skills, and attitudes for long-term recovery. Do you have a passion for promoting awareness of addiction and chemical dependency and helping those who may be impacted? Are you skilled in establishingand maintaining effective ongoing professional relationships with referral sources who can confidently recommend your programs to their clients? Do you want to work with a collaborative team that supports each other and believes that work can bring satisfaction and sometimes even joy? If so, we want to hear from you. We are seeking an experienced full-time Community Liaison/Business Development Professional to increase awareness of our specialized treatment programs to those within the LGBTQ+ community who can benefit from our programs and to professional referral sourcesacross the United States. Key objectives will be to inform, educate, and communicate our programs and services to ensure that people get the help they need. Reporting to and working with our Director of Business Development, the individual selected for this position will: Assist the Director in implementing the philosophy, policies, procedures, systems, and strategic goals set forth by the senior management team Market Pride Institute to an assigned territory in the US and to our local and in-state LGBTQ+ communities, involving up to 50% travel Identify potential referral sources and develop, manage, and grow relationships that result in referrals; provide effective contact management of both established and potential referral sources Consult with internal staff to encourage participation in business development efforts (presentations, conferences, events, etc.) as appropriate Track and evaluate the effectiveness of marketing activities,continually looking for ways to improve the effectiveness of marketing and outreach activities Summarize activities and submit timely reports on a regular basis

Job Requirements

Qualified candidates will possess: A Bachelors degree in marketing, counseling, social work, psychology, nursing or business administration OR equivalent work experience A minimum of three (3) years experience involving marketing and/or market research, event planning, community relations, and public speaking; advocacy and/or outreach experience related to the LGBTQ+ community is a huge plus Excellent verbal and written communication skills and presentation skills Experience in a behavioral health organization/facility is preferred.

item.title: Independent Contractor- Sales Consultant
item.dc:creator: Subway
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

HCP Media produces almost 100 print and digital publications annually for our strategic partners, including various custom versions of our books. Many of our loyal clients have been with us since our inception in 2000. OUR WORK INCLUDES
  • Multilingual destination guides, in-room hotel publications, in-flight magazines, digital magazines, websites and videos for our partners.
  • Marketing publications and materials for national and global companies targeting affluent, sophisticated consumers.
  • Commemorative coffee-table books, health care publications, program guides and other fee-based publications customized to our clients needs.
HCP Media is looking for a motivated, goal-orientedIndependent Contractorto sell advertising spacefor a local publication in theCharlestonmarket. This position is responsible for advertising sales.Achieve budgeted revenue goals by developing all new/incremental business possible in assigned territory. Maintain an awareness of local competitive conditions and improve market share. Build relationships, PR/Networking as an ambassador of the company by attending chamber functions and other networking opportunities.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Sell advertising space including print, online and niche products.
  • Acquire new advertising customers, secures continued advertising from former and current customers.
  • Calls on customers to assess advertising needs and advertising budget.
  • Assist customers in developing strategies concerning advertisement run dates, how to best target customers, and the benefits of advertising.
  • Achieving budgeted revenue goals by developing all new/incremental business in assigned territory.

Job Requirements

QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Previous Media Sales Experience a plus
  • Bi-lingual a plus (English/Spanish)
  • Strong organizational, written and communication skills
  • Proven ability to work independently
In order to be considered for this position, please submit a current resume and a cover letter to [Click Here to Email Your Resum] outlining your experience and qualifications for this position. The letter should include what work experience prepares you for this position specifically. The cover letter will be used to assess qualifying experience.

item.title: Senior Accountant
item.dc:creator: Levis
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Another Source's client, Stanford University, is recruiting a Senior Accountant to join their team. Here's a little about Stanford University and the position they are seeking to fill: Stanford University is one of a select group of American universities that have achieved eminence in both undergraduate and graduate education and in a broad range of academic disciplines. The University is internationally recognized for the quality of its teaching and research, its distinguished faculty and its outstanding student body. Our mission is to educate future leaders and promote interdisciplinary, world-class research and teaching. This passion makes Stanford an intensely creative, rewarding, and challenging place to work. Over the past 10-15 years, the business, technology and political environments have become more complex, faster paced, and litigious. Stringent accounting requirements have arisen to address the transparency of investments and keep pace with other areas of concern. New accounting standards have been issued for leases and not-for-profit accounting and reporting. In addition, other regulations and rules we need to comply with are more complex, e.g., international compliance considerations and banking regulations, and a new internal control framework COSO - has been adopted. Heightened scrutiny from our external auditors has resulted in more extensive requests for information in an effort to understand non-profits' business activities and related controls. Additionally, technology continues to change rapidly and the underlying tools further add to the complexity and riskiness of the environment. Within the Financial Management Services (FMS) organization, the Financial Analysis and Information Reporting team (FAIR) is part of the Controller's Office (CO) and is responsible for financial reporting, the coordination of our external audit, financial analysis, and a variety of general accounting activities. FMS's goal is to lead, drive and model best practices in financial management for the campus community, while maintaining proper controls and compliance with internal and external policies. FMS brings together the Controller's Office, Procurement, Office of the Treasurer, Global Business Services and Financial Management Consulting and Support. The Senior Accountant reports to the General Accounting Manager. In this role, the Senior Accountant will perform several functions: cash account reconciliations for multiple key University bank accounts, balance sheet account reconciliations for multiple payroll liability accounts, and working with the General Accounting Manager and Account Reconciliation Coordinator to redesign and implement an improved Account Reconciliation and Attestation program across the University. JOB PURPOSE: Perform complex accounting functions including designing and performing ad hoc analyses, developing and maintaining complex data models, analyzing large data sets, and reconciling complex accounts. CORE DUTIES:
    • Perform complex and detailed reconciliations, closure processes, research and critical analyses. Identify, prioritize, and resolve complex financial issues which may span multiple areas; identify underlying issues; recognize exceptions; recommend solutions.
    • Research possible solutions and make recommendations to department leadership based on audit / report reviews and identified accounting issues; advise leadership regarding business activities; provide cost analyses; plan studies; and determine business activity costs.
    • Research, and synthesize data; interpolate results from large amounts of data, identify trends in data, draw conclusions, develop solutions, present and implement recommendations, and create follow up analysis.
    • Develop complex financial data and metrics, reports for a variety of internal and external audiences.
    • Develop, design, or modify solutions for major segments of a program or accounting system; develop, recommend, implement and document new or revised policies and procedures.
    • Lead and support unit and organization strategy and change management initiatives. Analyze existing systems and processes; identify greater efficiencies and improved internal controls opportunities; incorporate new regulations; recommend solutions that may require policy changes or new processes.
    • Develop, recommend and implement new or revised policies and procedures for better controls and efficiencies. Participate in critical analysis of existing systems and processes, identifying and implementing process improvement opportunities.
    • May act as a lead, train, coach, and review the work of other staff, as needed. Contribute primarily through applying individual expertise.

Job Requirements

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: Education & Experience:
  • Bachelor's degree plus eight years of applicable experience, or an equivalent combination of education and relevant work experience.
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
    • Advanced proficiency in business applications, such as Microsoft Office; advanced Excel skills.
    • Advanced knowledge of accounting systems and the internet; computer literacy.
    • Ability to interpret and apply advanced accounting knowledge and understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles.
    • Strong communication skills, including the ability to clearly and effectively communicate information to internal and external audiences and client groups.
    • Demonstrated project management skills and ability to contribute/lead as part of a multi-functional team.
    • CPA preferred. Preference given to CPAs with a combination of Big 4 and industry experience.
    • Strong understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and the ability to interpret and apply advanced and complex accounting rules.
    • Solid understanding of COSO, compliance and internal controls.
    • Excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to communicate and impart technical accounting knowledge and information in an easy to understand manner. Ability to communicate decisions while educating at the same time. Establish good working relationships with a diverse population.
    • Strong sense of service orientation, with a proven ability to balance controls and compliance. Ability to develop solutions in situations where many variables are constrained and initiative to constantly improve the department.
    • High level of professionalism and integrity with a demonstrated ability to work productively with, and gain confidence of, many levels of an organization. Ability to maintain focus, successfully execute plans, bring closure to activities, tasks and projects. Proven track record of getting things done.
    • Advanced proficiency in business applications, such as Microsoft Office; advanced Excel skills and accounting systems (e.g., Oracle Financials). Preference given to candidates with experience using the Blackline account reconciliation tool.
    • Excellent organizational, analytical, and problem solving skills, an attention to detail, an ability to work independently, and the ability to work in a fast paced environment as an agent of change.
Stanford is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Another Source works with their clients, on a retained project basis, to maximize the recruiting process. *** To view a full job description and to be considered for this position, please apply directly on Stanford's career site, requisition 75043.

item.title: Construction Project Manager - Single Family Homes
item.dc:creator: Envato
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Construction Project Manager - Single Family Homes
Our client, a growing Real Estate Development Company, is currently seeking aConstruction Project Manager Single Family Homes in the greater Seattle, WA area. The successful candidate for theConstruction Project Manager will have these general responsibilities:
  • Oversee and manage the construction process from start to project completion.
  • Prepare estimates for construction projects to include material costs, labor equipment, subcontractor and overhead costs.
  • Manage Superintendent, subcontractors and employees.
  • Review construction documents.
  • Develop project objectives, policies, procedures and performance standards.
  • Coordinate the design efforts for internal and external consultants.
  • Frequently visit project sites to ensure quality and process.
  • Promote safe and efficient construction sites.
  • Ensure the projects stay within budget and on schedule.
 

Job Requirements

Construction Project Manager - Single Family Homes
Summary of requirements forConstruction Project Manager:
  • Bachelors degree inConstruction Management, Engineering or related discipline.Masters degree in Construction Management, Engineering or MBA preferred.
  • 5+ years of construction project management experience for single family housing.
  • Must have knowledge and experience of the residential construction process and equipment, materials and supplies.
  • Prior experience reading and interpreting construction documents and plans.
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast pace and team-oriented environment.
  • Self-driven, highly motivated, excellentleadership, communication, interpersonal, organizational, negotiation, decision making, and problem solving skills.
  • Proficient in MS Office Suite to include, MS Word, Outlook, Excel, Project and PowerPoint.
  • Must have a valid drivers license and current auto insurance.
Salary: $90 - $100K plus bonus potential This Company offers anexcellent benefits plan. For immediate consideration, please submit resume ASAP as an attachment in MS Word to call 888-974-0086 for additional information.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value:
The Science Museum is the most visited science and technology museum in Europe. There are over 15,000 objects on display, including world-famous objects such as the Apollo 10 command capsule and Stephensons Rocket.
Our interactive galleries bring to life first scientific principles and contemporary science debates. Plus, you can experience what its like to fly with the Red Arrows or blast off into space on an Apollo space mission in our stunning 3D and 4D simulators or watch a film on a screen taller than four double-decker buses in the IMAX 3D Cinema.

item.title: Treasury Services Sales Assistant
item.dc:creator: Levis
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Are you a retail banker looking for the next step in your career? CrossFirst Bank has multiple opportunities toapply yourproduct knowledge and customer services skills in a new area of the banking industry. With $2 billion in assets, CrossFirst Bank serves the financial needs of businesses, professionals and their families in Kansas City, Wichita, Oklahoma City, Tulsa and Dallas. Founded in 2007, CrossFirst has consistently been recognized as one of the fastest-growing and best performing banks in the country while achieving and maintaining excellent asset quality and a reputation for business excellence.   CrossFirst Banks commitment to their associates is as important as their commitment to their clients and community - it starts with serving people in extraordinary ways. CrossFirst offers their employees a highly collaborative culture, exceptional career opportunities, outstanding compensation and benefits, and a commitment to associate professional development and personal growth.   OMNI Human Resource Management serves as CrossFirst Bank's HR business partner and provides a variety of human resources support, including recruitment and search services.   Due to their continued and expected growth, we seek a Treasury Services Sales Assistant to join this high-performance team at their Country Club Plazalocation in Kansas City, MO. Responsibilities: Reporting to a Treasury Services Banker, this role will work closely with Treasury sales, Business Bankers and Treasury Services to proactively meet various client needs and requests both through administrative and customer service activities.
  • Assist in completing documentation for new sales and providing seamless coordination between sales and implementation.
  • Support the overall client relationship management effort by working directly with clients as various issues arise.
  • Support the Treasury sales team by responding to requests, researching discrepancies, and resolving issues.
  • Open deposit accounts for business clients and ensure accurate billing of services sold.
  • Complete risk reviews with clients.
  • Assist in completing process review documents created as part of a consultative sales process.
  • Build and maintain positive relationships; represent the Bank and Treasury Services team in a highly professional manner when working with other employees, clients and vendors.
  • Remain current with regulatory and/or Treasury product and service changes.

Job Requirements

  • Demonstrated three to five years experience working in a similar role on a fast paced, client-centric Treasury Services team, preferably within a commercial bank.
  • Substantial knowledge of treasury products, services and operations.
  • Demonstrated ability to prioritize work flow, multi-task, and work in a team based environment.
  • Outstanding reputation for customer service, persistence, flexibility and organizational skills.
  • Demonstrated knowledge and experience with MS Office Suite and related loan processing software.
  • Bachelors Degree in Business or related field preferred; High school diploma required.

item.title: Executive Assistant to CEO
item.dc:creator: Subway
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Title: Executive Assistant I Location: Savannah, GA FLSA Status: Nonexempt / Hourly Reports To: Chief Executive Officer Job Summary: Under general supervision, provides administrative support to the highest level of administration within the organization. Responsible for scheduling appointments, maintaining calendars, and managing multiple priorities. Assist in the preparation of reports, gathering and researching information, preparing presentations, coordinating meetings, copying and filing, preparing notes, performing data entry, and other special projects as needed. Reviews incoming correspondences to executive and forwards appropriately or, based on a knowledge of recipient's views, may respond for them. Assists in the administration and interpretation of policies and procedures for the organization and department. Maintains confidential information. May act as a spokesperson for departmental inquiries. Performs related responsibilities as required attention of the executive. Essential Functions:Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Executive Support for the Executive Leadership, including but not limited to: 1. Planning, coordination, and scheduling of Executive Leadership meetings, appointments, webinars, and conference calls 2. Planning and scheduling travel reservations and itineraries 3. Management of Executive Leadership Outlook accounts 4. Proactive, ongoing review in advance of CEO schedule and calendars to identify and resolve meeting conflicts and competing deadlines. 5. Proofing and conversion of CEO rough draft documents into final copy. 6. Screening of meeting requests and requests for information. 7. Preparation of documents for CEO signature. 8. Expense report preparation for CEO. Administrative Duties: Creation, production and distribution of agendas, memorandums, emails, meeting materials slideshow presentations Publishes Agency Monthly Newsletter plus special editions as requested. Maintains agency Facebook account and Website. Materials purchasing Coordination of mail projects In conjunction with webmaster, maintenance and posting of information of website Maintenance of information on the intranet website Following up with local print media to ensure agency announcements and press releases are being run. Planning, coordination, communications, purchasing, materials preparation, and minutes taking for management meetings, including but not limited to: o Executive Leadership o Board of Directors meetings and associated subcommittees o Board Retreat o Leadership Training o Town Hall Meetings Project Management: Assists with public relations and event advertisement as needed. Maintains an adequate supply of promotional items for use at events. Prioritizes time and resources among areas of responsibility. Sets goals and defines measurement of progress. Seeks feedback to determine status of ongoing projects or programs. Accomplishes all tasks as appropriately assigned or requested. Maintains organizational and time management skills Serves on project teams or various departments for administrative related matters.

Job Requirements

Required Education & Experience: Bachelor's degree in business administration, communications or a related field from an accredited college or university AND three years of office administration or senior secretarial experience, or equivalent combination of experience, education, and training. Gateway is an equal opportunity employer. To be considered for this opportunity, please respond with resume to this posting.

item.title: CEO / COO / EVP / RVP / VP / GM / Vice President / General Manager
item.dc:creator: Airbnb
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

This isnt your normal job ad.Please read the job description in it's entirety before applying. If you are reading this, you might be in the same position I was not long ago. A talented, high-performing, high-potential business leader searching the job boards for something new. Something better. Something more fulfilling. Something to bring back that spark that made you a successful business leader in the first place. I did what you are doing. I searched for the position titles above. I worked with recruiters, I worked my network, and I applied to jobs. Sometimes I had a response, sometimes I didnt. I made it through phone screens, initial interviews and even final interviews but I found the challenge of conquering the process much more exciting than the prospects of the actual job that I was applying for. In hindsight I know why. Deep down I knew that all of the jobs I was qualified for, interested in, and applying to were simply the same story that I had lived, breathed and worked tirelessly (for other peoples benefit) for way too many years. Dont be the definition of insanity. The same people doing the same thing and expecting a different result. I used to preach this to my teams and my employees in the business world to help facilitate change. Yet, I found myself proving the exact definition in my personal job search. I was the same person looking to do the same thing and expecting a change in my professional gratification". The light bulb went off. I realized I needed to broaden my horizons and I started to look at business ownership as a potential career option. I had thought about it for years, but never too seriously. That was until I stumbled across a franchise opportunity with Patrice & Associates. After many weeks of due diligence, I decided to change my career path from employment to empowerment in achieving my income, lifestyle, wealth, and equity goals and invested in a Patrice & Associates franchise. Starting a business from scratch was too daunting, but Patrice & Associates provided the systems, tools, training, coaching, and mentoring that I needed to significantly boost my opportunity for success. Now my spark is back. Im applying my learned business skills at a local level and coaching, training and mentoring my own employees. Ive taken control of my own destiny. If I can do it, so can you. Opportunities throughout New Jersey and Long Island, NY. There are additional Patrice & Associates franchise opportunities available in New Jersey and Long Island, NY. See below for more information:

We are the Largest Hospitality Recruiting Firm in the Country and Growing Rapidly

As a franchisee with Patrice & Associates youll be joining one of the hottest industries of the futurethe Staffing Industry. We specialize in placing people in Hospitality, one of the top 5 growth industries through 2020. Your earning potential is unlimited! Strong Fundamental Macro Environment
  • The restaurant industry is the nations second-largest private-sector area ofemployment, with approximately 990,000 establishments employing a total of more than 14 million workers almost one-tenth of the nations workforce.
  • An estimated 1.7 million new restaurant jobs will created by the year 2025
  • Restaurant Industrys share of the food dollar per household is 47%
  • Total economic impact of the Restaurant Industry is estimated at $1.8 trillion
  • Restaurant Sales constitute 9% of the entire US GDP
  • The restaurant industry has a high turnover ratio of over 75% resulting in constant recruiting opportunities
Existing Clients There are nearly 1 million restaurants with an average of 4 to 7 managers per restaurant. We are a staffing partner who sources qualified managers for most major restaurant chains such as California Pizza Kitchen, Applebees, Golden Corral, IHOP, Panera Bread, Fuddruckers, Burger King, TGI Fridays, Lubys, University and Hospital Cafeterias, Gourmet Grocery Stores, Airport Concourses, Hotels, and many more. Turnkey Operation = Fast Cash Flow
  • Extensive training and ongoing support no hospitality or recruiting experience required
  • Access to our database with over 300,000 hospitality and restaurant management resumes
  • Established contracts with more than 500 open jobs nationwide waiting to be filled with quality managers
  • We are 100% virtual and never in-person interview anyone you can have a summer and winter home or even travel the country in an RV and recruit!
You are in business the day you come to training! No Territory Restrictions You will have a territory to develop but you are free to WORK THE ENTIRE COUNTRY so it does not matter where you live or what natural disasters happen - you will still be in business! Meaningful Service We are a career coach helping restaurant and hospitality managers find jobs offering true opportunity. We have a chance to change someones life every single day! We help people find better jobs, better benefits, and better quality of life. WE MAKE A DIFFERENCE!

Internet, Telephone & Computer is all you need to get started!

Work from Home or Open an Office Extensive On-going Training & Support $58,000 franchise fee + $11,000 setup and training fee - third party financing available

Job Requirements

REQUIREMENTS
  • Self-motivated and driven
  • Sales experience or ability
  • Zero phone reluctance
  • Desire to own and manage your own business
  • This opportunity requires an investment & is not a job offer - you will be your own boss!
  key words:franchise, business, work from home, owner, recruiter, multi-unit manager, district manager, area manager, regional manager, vice president, president, CEO, Director, human resources, recruiter, franchise opportunity, staffing, executive, manager, sales, consultant

item.title: RN Healthcare Services Auditor
item.dc:creator: Airbnb
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Job Summary Molina Healthcare Services (HCS) works with members, providers and multidisciplinary team members to assess, facilitate, plan and coordinate an integrated delivery of care across the continuum, including behavioral health and long term care, for members with high need potential. HCS staff work to ensure that patients progress toward desired outcomes with quality care that is medically appropriate and cost-effective based on the severity of illness and the site of service. Knowledge/Skills/Abilities * Performs monthly auditing of registered nurse functions in Healthcare Services and Nurse Advice for compliance with CMS, NCQA, URAC, State and Federal requirements. * Coaches registered nurses in appropriate clinical decision-making. * Reports monthly outcomes, identifies areas of re-training for staff, and communicates findings to staff and leadership. * Maintains member/provider confidentiality in compliance with the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) and professionalism with all communications. * Adheres to departmental standards, policies, protocols. * Maintains detailed records of auditing results * Assists HCS training team with developing training materials or job aids as needed to address findings in audit results * Communicate with the Supervisor and Manager of QA Issues identified and works collaboratively to resolve/correct issues. * 5 - 15% local travel may be required.

Job Qualifications

Required Education Completion of an accredited Registered Nurse (RN) Program and an Associate's or Bachelor's Degree in Nursing. Required Experience Minimum two years UM, CM, and/or managed care experience. Proficient knowledge of Molina workflows. Required License, Certification, Association Active, unrestricted State Registered Nursing (RN) license in good standing. Must have valid driver's license with good driving record and be able to drive within applicable state or locality with reliable transportation. Preferred Education Bachelor's Degree in Nursing Preferred Experience 3-5 years in case management, disease management, managed care or medical or behavioral health settings. Preferred License, Certification, Association N/A To all current Molina employees: If you are interested in applying for this position, please apply through the Intranet job listing. Molina Healthcare offers a competitive benefits and compensation package. Molina Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) M/F/D/V.

item.title: Graphic Designer
item.dc:creator: Envato
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

The Toledo Zoo is committed to inspiring others to join us in caring for animals and conserving the natural world. As part of that mission, the Toledo Zoo is accredited by the Association of Zoos and Aquariums (AZA), and is a leader in global wildlife conservation. AZA member institutions are dedicated to providing excellent care for animals, a great experience for visitors and a better future for all living things. Do you enjoy a fast paced environment where you have the ability to design for a variety of projects? The Toledo Zoo and Aquarium is currently hiring a creative, engaging Graphic Designer to, under limited supervision, create and design digital and print graphics in line with the Toledo Zoos communication objectives and goals. Designer will utilize software programs for graphic design and perform hands on painting, drawing, illustrations and other visual arts projects. The Graphic Designer will also create and design print projects and exhibits which involves maintenance of computer hardware and software expertise, production, revisions, text changes, proofing and maintenance. Will also design and layout electronic web creative; Snapchat, GeoFilters, Social Media Images, Storyboards, iPad marketing collateral and utilize various resources for visual arts projects including computer programs, photography, painting, illustrating and digital outputs of all varieties. Design aspects may include; merchandise, signage, guide maps, membership packages, marketing/PR materials, Safari! Magazine, online content such as online ads, banners and emails, exhibit interactives and other components. Will also be responsible for translating design tactics into digital solutions that achieve growth and Zoo awareness goals while supporting and advancing the Zoos digital strategy. To take the next step in the process for theGraphic Designerrole, you will complete a Culture Index Survey. In addition to reviewing applicants qualifications and experience, the Culture Index Survey helps us better understand overall fit and how individuals prefer to be managed, motivated and communicated with. When completing the survey, you must attach a copy of your resume and include your salary requirement. Applicants without an attached resume will not be considered. Please copy and open the following link into your browser to begin the survey. https://www.cindexinc.com/c/4FDE0B.  

Job Requirements

For our Graphic Designer position, we prefer a Bachelors degree in graphic design, visual arts, or related field and two to four years of experience in a graphic or visual arts field, or any equivalent combination of education and experience. If requested, applicants must be able to provide a portfolio of previous work/projects for review. The Toledo Zoo is an Equal Opportunity Employer and a drug and alcohol free workplace.

item.title: Development Engineer
item.dc:creator: Levis
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Development Engineer

Our client, an Engineered to Order manufacturer in NY is searching for a highly qualified Development Engineer for their growing organization. This is an opportunity to join a leading designer and international manufacturer serving world class companies across the globe! REPORTING TO: Director of Engineering OBJECTIVE:
  • The Development Engineer will oversee the conception and design of processing equipment.
  • The primary responsibility of the development engineer is to create a product design that fulfills the client's strategic goals while integrating the needs of marketing, sales and manufacturing departments. They create design concepts, lead testing procedures and draft specifications for manufacturing.
  • Support individual customers by providing engineering expertise during the quotation phase (initially) and ensuring a smooth transition into design engineering upon receipt of an order. They may meet with customers and would work closely with the Sr. Tech and AE during quote/sale processes.
  • The Development Engineer would help ensure feasibility of concept, use of relevant reference jobs, review of estimates, etc. so that orders can be executed smoothly.
  • The Development Engineer will create the path from concept to design, and may serve as the PE when an order is received. Part of their time would be devoted to working with Tech/AE group on proposals.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Primary duties for the Development Engineer include identifying the needs and goals for a new product, from function to aesthetics. They often coordinate with market researchers and materials suppliers to evaluate market needs, existing competition and potential costs.
  • The Development Engineer then creates a design using computer-aided design software and fabricates models that can be tested. They experiment with and analyze different materials, manufacturing processes, design tolerances and other factors in the developmental process. After refining and reviewing initial designs, product development engineers deliver specifications and procedures to manufacturing teams who can then begin production.
  • In collaboration with Sales, Project Engineering, Applications, and The Technology Team review project requirements, technical specifications, and reference drawings to prepare layouts for parts/sub-assemblies from concept phase through detailed design & drawings
  • Perform FEA analysis, heat transfer, fluid dynamics, statics and strength of material calculations. Utilize knowledge about design considerations for heat resistant alloys.
  • Evaluate equipment & make suggestions regarding design improvements.
  • Lead small to large sized new product development projects.

Job Requirements

REQUIREMENTS:
  • Bachelors degree in Mechanical Engineering required.
  • Must have a minimum of five (5) years experience in the Development of industrial equipment.
  • Must possess mechanical knowledge of custom OEM equipment, machines, and components including their design, uses, repair, and maintenance.
  • Familiarity with high temperature materials, welding, weld symbols, fabrication (especially large structural equipment), sheet metal, and mechanical drive components necessary.
  • Knowledge of the practical application of engineering science and technology and the ability to apply that knowledge to custom, innovative design concepts.
  • Proficient with 3D CAD systems, such as Inventor.
  • Knowledge of best practice design techniques such as DFM, GD&T, etc. with an ability to read and interpret technical drawings. Experience creating and interpreting P&ID drawings a plus.
  • Must possess excellent verbal & written communication skills with a focus on providing excellent customer service. Strong commitment teamwork and integrating information from multi-disciplined teams.
  • Strong hands on" bias. Enjoys building large and complex equipment. Propensity to take things apart to figure out how they work. Curious by nature.
  • Up to 25% travel required-both domestic & international
PHYSICAL DEMANDS:
  • The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
  • While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to walk. The employee is frequently required to sit, use hands, reach with hands and arms, talk and hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl.
SALARY:
  • Salary for this direct hire position will be commensurate with experience and will include a competitive benefits package, paid holidays and vacation, room for growth, relocation package, etc.
HOW TO APPLY:
  • Interested and qualified candidates should submit a Word formatted resume, employment references, and salary history to [Click Here to Email Your Resum] for immediate consideration.
  • Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V

TxMQ, Inc.

Contract, Contract to Hire and Direct Hire Staffing Services and Solutions

www.txmqstaffing.com |www.txmq.com

item.title: Director of Information Technology
item.dc:creator: Google
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Our client is looking for a Director of IT to lead our team of Network, IT, Security and DevOps professionals, and to supportgrowth in a fast-paced entrepreneurial environment handling multiple responsibilities. Primary Responsibilities:
  • The Director of IT will lead and direct cross-functional teams of technical experts
  • Maintain our existing network, including:
    • Connections to all major US Mobile Carriers: MPLS, Point-to-Point & VPN
    • Complex traffic shaping, rate limiting, security and filtering
    • RADIUS & DIAMETER traffic
  • The Director of IT will maintain our existing platforms, including:
    • AWS environments existing & migration of physical environments
    • System Administration
    • Monitoring tools
  • The Director of IT will design, implement and deliver infrastructure solutions including:
    • Definition of scope
    • Project planning
    • Scheduling & prioritization
    • Contingency and risk planning
    • Work assignments and personnel.
  • The Director of IT will manage all aspects of Information Security, including:
    • Network Security & Borders defense
    • Compliance (PCI, SOC, etc) policies and procedures
    • IPS/IDS implementation and on-going maintenance
    • Audit trails, Backups & Disaster Recovery
  • Identify and implement process improvements
  • Manage multiple vendors relationships
  • Inventory, licenses and procurement

Job Requirements

Qualifications:
  • 15+ years of technology development and management
  • Bachelors degree in Electrical Engineering/Computer Science/equivalent work experience
  • Extensive hands-on networking and troubleshooting experience in large, distributed environments
  • Extensive knowledge of TCP/IP, VLANs, Spanning Tree, multicast, VRF, QoS, BGP, OSPF, as well as MPLS connectivity/architecture
  • Security principles, certification requirements and processes
  • AWS Architecture and security
  • Planning, organization, professionalism
  • Willingness to work in an unstructured environment
  • Clear communication at all levels
Preferred Qualifications:
  • Wireless Telecom networks and infrastructure

item.title: Director of Training & Medical Education
item.dc:creator: DHL
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Late stage ophthalmic, medical device start up seeking a new Director of Training & Medical Education in Orange County. This Director of Training & Medical Education will be a pivotal role on the medical affairs team to lead internal & external training. This individual will be developing & executing trainings and also have a support function for monitoring activities. My client has successfully commercially launched late last year and are looking to expand their commercial efforts- this role will be instrumental to this growth and offers excellent visibility with internal & external stakeholders in the ophthalmic space. Competitive pay, bonus, and equity offered-this role is a direct hire full time position onsite with anticipated 50% travel. Local candidates preferred but relocation can be discussed. Job Responsibilities:
  • Development and implementation of training programs, tools
    • Responsible for tracking outcomes globally
    • Manage and execute educational seminars and symposiums
    • Develops training strategies to update commercial sites in appropriate patient selection, surgical application and technique and could provide support during surgery. Secures the appropriate follow up (medical regimen, post operative visits, tracking outcomes) are routinely completed by the users
  • Publication strategy
    • Support the successful implementation and execution of evidence plan
    • Support of peer to peer, podium, and trade publication development and submissions
    • Review and interpret study results as well as generates and/or reviews publications, posters and scientific presentations
  • Field clinical support
    • Support post market clinical and investigator initiated studies
    • Field clinical support and training
    • Interaction with users in the field (study sites, commercial users, KOLs).
    • Available for training new accounts when necessary
    • Expert resource to commercial team
  • Professional relations
    • Supporting KOL program
    • Supporting medical advisory board strategy
    • Manage and respond to requests for information from the field.
Qualifications/Requirements:
  • Minimum 10 years of experience with sales training & professional education in ophthalmology medical device or pharmaceutical industry
  • Experience working closely with physicians globally
  • Excellent communication skills
Preferred experience
  • Professional degree (MD, OD, PhD, PharmD) with appropriate clinical and medical affairs experience
  • Experience in Ophthalmology (ideally cataract and refractive surgery)

item.title: Insurance Account Representative / Agent Trainee
item.dc:creator: DHL
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Insurance Account Rep / Agent Trainee (Sales Financial Services)
Sales Professionalsare you looking for a rewarding new position with an established and respected brand? Join our team at Jeff Horan State Farm Insurance Agency Inc! For over 10 years, we have built our reputation on providing top quality sales and service in the New York area; its our commitment to being "Here to help life go right." In order to support our tremendous growth, we are currently seeking Insurance Account Representatives and Agent Trainees, entrepreneurs that market State Farm insurance and financial services to work with our team in Westbury, NY. We offer a very competitive compensation package, including full benefits. If this sounds like the kind of opportunity youve been waiting for, and if you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you. Contact us today!
Insurance Account Rep / Agent Trainee (Sales Financial Services)
Job Responsibilities As an Insurance Account Representative or Agent Trainee, you will serve as our sales force and provide expert guidance and business development of all aspects of our company. Your specific duties will include:
  • Building solid business relationships with clients
  • The willingness, passion, and effort to be successful
  • Maintaining a thorough knowledge of State Farm's services
  • Performing all functions in an accurate, professional, and timely manner

Job Requirements

Insurance Account Rep / Agent Trainee (Sales Financial Services)
Job Requirements As an Insurance Account Representative or Agent Trainee, you must be highly organized and detail-oriented while also having a positive and engaging personality. It is also important that you display excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills as well as the ability to interact in a knowledgeable and professional manner with customers, and our own sales and other internal departments. Specific qualifications for the role include:
  • Sales and/or Insurance related experience
  • Excellent telephone and interpersonal skills
  • Strong computer skills, particularly MS Word, Excel, and Outlook
  • Solid time-management and multitasking abilities
  • Bilingual - English/Spanish Strongly preferred
Insurance Account Rep / Agent Trainee (Sales Financial Services)
Benefits As an Insurance Account Representatives or Agent Trainee with Jeff Horan State Farm Insurance Agency, you will be part of an established organization. Your hard work and professional dedication will be rewarded with a competitive compensation package that includes a great list of benefits, including:
  • Health, vision, and dental coverage
  • Life and disability insurance
  • Bonuses
  • 401(k) retirement plan
  • Paid vacations
  • Paid holidays
Insurance Account Rep / Agent Trainee (Sales Financial Services)
Build a great career with us at Jeff Horan State Farm Insurance Agency!
Apply now!

item.title: Early Education Program & Training Specialist
item.dc:creator: Envato
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Early Education Program & Training Specialist Trinet has been retained to help one of their growing clients fill the need for two (2) Early Education Program & Training Specialist positions in the San Francisco area (94105). We are conveniently located on BART, Ferry, and Main Transit terminal. We are the global leaders in early childhood development programs with over 700 learning centers world-wide. Designed by experts, our age-appropriate play classes for ages birth-5 help develop the cognitive, physical and social skills of children. Our programs are also recognized for their artful approach to parent involvement. Join our fun + talented team of global educators as a curricula & training specialist. Inspire a world of learning for families through play! Are you a training specialist with a playful personality and a passion for the early education space? If so, this is a great place for you to put your talents to work. THIS IS NOT A JOB TEACHING IN A DAYCARE CENTER! Curriculum Development Support course development and instructional design Collaborate on the development and evaluation of lesson plans Provide technical writing and formatting to courses Coordinate field testing and teacher support for curriculum development Field teaching & training to support R&D goals Training Experience delivering traditional & modern training methods; e-learning, webinar, workshop, live training, site-level mentoring, and interactive course exercises Provide mentorship and outreach to other early childhood professionals to successfully deliver our learning approach. Assess instructional effectiveness of tools and provide reporting on training outcomes Implement training calendar & records, coordinate materials for training. Job Requirements A passion for children, parents and the education space Professional training and teaching experience Strong written and verbal communication skills Confident singing voice and engaging public speaker skills Professional early childhood experience strongly preferred Experience writing curriculum strongly preferred Developing programs experience strongly preferred Able to lead brand culture across HO leadership and center staff Basic or Intermediate. Computer skills to include Microsoft Office systems, e-learning platform skill a plus Willingness to travel & train regionally 25% with 3-4 overnights a year. Demonstrated mentoring and training skills. Bachelors degree in education, arts, or related field.   Competitive salary and benefits THIS POSITION DOES NOT HAVE THE ABILITY TO SPONSOR

Job Requirements

Professional training and teaching experience Experience writing curriculum strongly preferred

item.title: Marketing Communications / Business Administration Assistant
item.dc:creator: Subway
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Marketing Communications / Business Administration Assistant PURPOSE: Marketing, communication & administration for our company - Paid Training - TravelOpportunities -Management for those that qualify MAJOR RESPONSIBILITY AREAS -Implementation of marketing plans, including product positioning, campaign strategies, and market strategy insights. -Discovery of strategic business opportunities through cross function collaboration with sales, HR, etc. -Marketing opportunity for revenue -Provide product/service support in order to establish proper channels of information and communication. -Responsible for branding, advertising, trade shows, company events and promotional collateral -Work with management on projects dealing with media relations, business communications, success stories CORE COMPETENCIES: These are personal traits that will best help the associate to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Stress Tolerance - Job requires accepting criticism and dealing calmly and effectively with high stress situations. Judgment and Decision Making - Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one. Integrity - Job requires being honest and ethical. Initiative - Job requires a willingness to take on responsibilities and challenges. Leadership - Job requires a willingness to lead, take charge, and offer opinions and direction. Achievement/Effort - Job requires establishing and maintaining personally challenging achievement goals and exerting effort toward mastering tasks. Dependability - Job requires being reliable, responsible, and dependable, and fulfilling obligations. Social Orientation - Job requires preferring to work with others rather than alone, and being personally connected with others on the job. Attention to Detail - Job requires being careful about detail and thorough in completing work tasks. Cooperation - Job requires being pleasant with others on the job and displaying a good-natured, cooperative attitude. Candidate must be very articulate, have a sense of humor, easygoing, but very disciplined. We need a culture fit!

Job Requirements

-Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business Administration, Communications, Advertising or Journalism -Minimum (0) zero to (5) five years of relevant experience in marketing management with proven success, however we offer paid training -Must have wide range of experience and understanding of the marketing including product positioning, pricing, promotions, market research, sales and distribution. -Should be a proactive self-starter with the ability to work independently. Need strong ability to set priorities, solve problems, and be resourceful under pressure. -Experience working with agency/client partners, exhibiting the ability to generate maximum return through effective marketing strategies and direction. .

item.title: Community Development Mortgage Loan Officer - Amherst
item.dc:creator: Levis
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

ABOUT THE JOB (JOB BRIEF): The Community Development Banking (CDB) Loan Officer (LO) is responsible for covering a cluster of retail bank branches on the origination of residential mortgage loans. The CDB LO is expected to call on government sponsored entities and (private) not- for- profit housing agencies supporting low- to- moderate income housing interests and initiatives in the communities they serve. The CDB LO is expected to be on- site at their assigned branch(s) for the full 8 hour day, except as necessary to accommodate work commitments outside of the branch or outside of regular banking hours, which may necessitate a flexible work schedule, and is expected to perform joint efforts with branch partners on increasing the mortgage opportunities within their existing client base. Any outside networking with outside referral sources should be handled in conjunction with the assigned branch partners as well as with the district CDB Compliance Officers and/or CDB Compliance Regional Managers. In addition, the CDB LO should be involved in community/ outreach programs, as well as participation with local housing agencies and non- profits, grant providers, etc. The CDB LO is expected to collaborate with the third party fulfillment company to meet the needs of our customers from the point of registration to closing. CDB LO is expected to meet or exceed established sales, cross- sell and referral goals congruently with maintaining high standards of client satisfaction and quality. This position is expected to manage client referrals and cross sell opportunities ensuring all new customers are introduced to local branches. CDB LO should maintain sales/originator systems and efficient work flows. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: The role of the CDB LO is to call on government sponsored entities and (private) not- for- profit housing agencies supporting low- to- moderate income housing interests and initiatives in the communities they serve in order to originate and process 1- 4 family residential real estate mortgage loans in accordance with KBM's Process and Product Guidelines. The CDB LO is responsible for gathering documents at the time of registering a loan and is expected to remain the point of contact with the customer during the duration of the loan. This person is to maintain high standards of client satisfaction and quality, and ensure sales/originator systems and work flows are efficiently controlled. The CDB LO also is responsible for managing client referrals and the cross sell process ensuring all new customers are introduced to local branches. The CDB LO is responsible for knowing all Federal Regulations and bank policies. As needed and in partnership with assigned branch partners, the CDB LO is expected to help with joint calls with potential clients to develop new business both in person and over the phone. As needed and in partnership with assigned branches and CDB Compliance partners, the CDB LO is to represent the Bank in various community functions to further enhance its image and develop and promote additional business relationships. The CDB LO is to keep informed of trends and developments in the real estate market and mortgage industry. In addition, the CDB LO is to develop and maintain in- depth knowledge of products and services as well as knowledge of competitors and competitive products. Daily Branch Activities: - Review Book of Business client profiles with Relationship Managers to uncover mortgage opportunities. - Discuss any cross sell opportunities discovered by LO. - Review mortgage pipeline with Branch Managers and/or Retail Relationship Managers (RM), as directed by branch. - Expedite loans in process by conducting regular pipeline reviews with process(s), follow up on documentation with borrowers, interact with title companies, realtors, attorneys, etc. - Meet with clients for mortgage opportunities as scheduled. - Interact with customer traffic. Make introductions and pass out business cards. - COI calls should take place as part of the normal work day and should involve the branch staff or private banking staff, as appropriate. - Interact with all branch personnel. - Time spent in the branch will include "Monthly Activities". Monthly Branch Activities Include But Not Limited To: - Key at Work Calls: Make at least one Key at Work call with branch or RM rotating among assigned branches. - Lights Camera Action (LCA) Meetings: Attend at least one LCA meeting per assigned branch and discuss mortgage topic. - Key Team Meetings: Attend at least one Key Team meeting fully prepared with referrals. - Call Nights: Participate in at least one branch call night. - Production Reviews: Meet with Branch Manager monthly to review mortgage production to goal results. Discuss commitments and plans for success for the next month based on the annual mortgage production goal. At the January review, discuss the annual goal and what it will take to achieve; how many referrals are needed for each application, how many applications are needed for each closing. Discuss commitments. - COI Calls: COI calls should take place as part of the LO's normal day in their assigned branch and should involve the branch staff. - Mortgage Day: Conduct one Mortgage Day each month, rotating among assigned branches. Schedule two weeks in advance for event promotion as follows: attend LCA meeting to announce date and discuss event; provide flyers to branch for event promotion; and determine snacks to be provided if applicable. - Affordable Housing Calls: Make at least one call focused on affordable housing (i.e., Non- profit organizations and Local Housing Authorities). REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS: - Minimum of three (3) years experience as a loan officer in 1st mortgage production with an emphasis in Community Development lending. - Bachelor's degree in business related field or equivalent experience. - Working knowledge of FNMA, FHLMC, FHA, VA, local state housing programs, TIL regulations, Equal Credit Opportunity Act, RESPA regulations, local and state real estate and finance laws. - Excellent written and oral communication skills and ability to work in a team environment. - Demonstrated strong customer service skills. - Proficiency in sales and service techniques, including tele- consulting, prospecting and networking. - Strong financial acumen. Employees in this job are required to comply with all rules and regulations of The Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing Act of 2008 (The SAFE Act). Employees hired or transferring into this position will need to meet the qualification requirements, in Key's sole discretion, under Reg. Z, prior to acting as a loan originator in a consumer credit transaction secured by a dwelling. Qualification requirements include but are not limited to an assessment of overall financial responsibility, character, and general fitness through review of a criminal background check, credit report, and information about any administrative, civil, or criminal findings by any government jurisdiction. ABOUT KEY: KeyCorps roots trace back 190 years to Albany, New York. Headquartered in Cleveland, Ohio, Key is one of the nations largest bank-based financial services companies with assets of approximately $101 billion as of June 30, 2016. The acquisition of First Niagara Financial Group, which became effective on August 1, 2016, is expected to add assets of approximately $40 billion, based on June 30, 2016 balances. Key provides deposit, lending, cash management and investment services to individuals and small and mid-sized businesses in 15 states under the name KeyBank National Association and First Niagara Bank, National Association, through a network of more than 1,200 branches and more than 1,500 ATMs. Key also provides a broad range of sophisticated corporate and investment banking products, such as merger and acquisition advice, public and private debt and equity, syndications and derivatives to middle market companies in selected industries throughout the United States under the KeyBanc Capital Markets trade name. ABOUT THE BUSINESS: Key Community Bank serves individuals and small to midsized businesses from Maine to Alaska through our 15-state network of over 1,200 branches, 1,500 ATMs, telephone banking and robust online and mobile platforms. KeyBanks Consumer/Business Banking segment provides consumers and small business owners with straightforward banking solutions and personal finance expertise that helps them make confident financial decisions today and plan for tomorrow. Key Private Bank offers wealth planning that follows a consistent, disciplined approach guided by objective advice based on each unique situation. KeyBank Commercial Bank offers midsize business financial services that drive growth and profitability and help business owners identify new opportunities with products and services including deposit, cash management, investment services, commercial lending, equipment leasing, and asset-based lending. FLSA STATUS:Non-Exempt KeyCorp is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer committed to engaging a diverse workforce and sustaining an inclusive culture. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

item.title: Healthcare Services Coordinator
item.dc:creator: Google
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Position Description: Welcome to one of the toughest and mostfulfilling ways to help people, including yourself. We offer the latest tools,most intensive training program in the industry and nearly limitlessopportunities for advancement. Join us and start doing your life's best work. Positions in this function (with the exception of Healthcare Services Coordinator) require education / certification / licensure other than an RN, such as BSW, MSW, Respiratory Therapist, Dietician, Nutritionist, Occupational Therapist, etc. Positions are responsible for providing clinical and medical management services, including case management, health assessments, interventions, and discharge planning. May identify, coordinate or provide appropriate levels of care under the direct supervision of an RN or MD. This function does not include Health Coach, Health Educator and Health Advocate roles that do not require an RN. Those roles are found in the Wellness Coach Management function. Primary Responsibilities:
  • Providing exceptional customer service
  • Multitasking, inbound / outbound phone calls to members and / or physicians
  • Completing assessments and documentation within a CER system
  • Provide benefit explanation
  • Health care knowledge surrounding disease management, community resources, durable medical / consumable products
  • You will be providing care coordination telephonically; completing assessments and documentation within a clinical system while multitasking other applications gathering information to support member's needs
  • Must have excellent typing, writing and grammar skills
  • Primary responsibilities are telephonic case management and some administrative responsibilities for the clinical department related to member care
  • Very fast paced environment. 10+ people, team player, goal focused, must be a self-motivated, take initiative and willing to learn in a fast environment
  • Moderate work experience within own function
  • Some work is completed without established procedures
  • Basic tasks are completed without review by others
  • Supervision / guidance is required for higher level tasks
  • Role assists in coordinating health services and does not write care plans
Required Qualifications:
  • High School Diploma or GED
  • 2+ years of experience working in a case management or a telephonic healthcare environment
  • Experience with Microsoft Outlook (send emails and set folders) and Microsoft Excel (update spreadsheets)
  • Experience with medical terminology, benefits management, claim, and / or healthcare insurance
Preferred Requirements:
  • Bilingual (Spanish)
Soft Skills:
  • Strong typing, writing and grammar skills
Careers at UnitedHealthcare Community & State. Challenge brings out the best in us. It also attracts the best. That's why you'll find some of the most amazingly talented people in health care here. We serve the health care needs of low income adults and children with debilitating illnesses such as cardiovascular disease, diabetes, HIV/AIDS and high-risk pregnancy. Our holistic, outcomes-based approach considers social, behavioral, economic, physical and environmental factors. Join us. Work with proactive health care, community and government partners to heal health care and create positive change for those who need it most. This is the place to do your life's best work. Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.

item.title: Director of Integrated Healthcare Services
item.dc:creator: Google
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

InterCommunity, Inc. is a growing, progressive, non-profit community health center with over 35 years of experience in the community. Weve been the grateful recipient over the past several years of numerous local and national awards for the innovative services we provide, and have recently been named a Hartford Courant/Fox CT Top Small Workplace Award winner for the SIXTH consecutive year!   We are currently recruiting a F/T experienced DIRECTOR for our INTEGRATED SERVICES who will oversee the day-to-day functions of our Primary Care, Front Desk, Call Center and Facilities teams and ensure that the needs of our service delivery staff are met. This individual will maintain the high performance standards we aspire to as an agency while supporting our mission statement and philosophy and helping our clinical staff provide the best in patient care. This individual must be a Registered Nurse. Responsibilities
  • Oversee Practice Managers located at our East Hartford and Hartford locations
  • Ensure Practice Managers and support staff adhere to policies and procedures
  • Ensure all mandatory reporting and data tracking is completed in a timely manner
  • Ensure monthly audits are completed
  • Work closely with other Directors to ensure patients are able to receive high quality care in all divisions
  • Help create and implement systems to improve flow and patient outcomes
  • Provide on-the-ground leadership
  • Oversee payroll within your departments
  • Ensure supplies are managed appropriately

Job Requirements

To be considered for this position, an applicant MUST meet the following requirements:
    • Current Connecticut RN licensure required
    • 7+ years of strong experience managing a medical practice. Applicants without this experience will not be considered.
    • Bachelors Degree strongly preferred. Degree may be substituted for equivalent in education, training and experience.
    • Excellent organizational, interpersonal, communication and customer service skills
    • Considerable knowledge of health care administration
    • Considerable knowledge of and ability to apply management principles and techniques
    • Strong, current computer skills
    • Strong judgment, flexibility and ability to adapt
    • Ability to establish and manage multiple priorities
    • Ability to work effectively in a team-based environment
    • The ability to approach all aspects of the work from a culturally competent, trauma informed, gender responsive and recovery oriented perspective
      Strong candidates should also possess:
    • FQHC experience preferred
    • Spanish speaking preferred
    • A belief that every individual in need deserves quality service and an opportunity for recovery
    • A commitment to professional growth and development as well as to organizational growth
    • Experience with CareLogic and/or Greenway a plus
    Intercommunity, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer offering competitive salaries, a generous employee benefit package (including medical, dental, disability, life insurance, 401(k), and 4 weeks of paid time off) and flexible schedules. Bilingual (English/Spanish) candidates are encouraged to apply.

item.title: Arts, Media & Music Opportunities
item.dc:creator: Airbnb
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Some of the most important and exciting careers in the country are performed by U.S. Army Soldiers. Whether its working with computers to assisting physicians to fixing helicopters, theres an Army job thats right for you. See for yourself the long list of job and leadership training opportunities that give you the skills and strength to succeed in the Armyand in life.   Art / Media / Music Art, Media & Music positions cover the administration, communication and supervision of Army public affairs for both military and civilian audiences. Opportunities are available in areas such as:
  • Broadcasting
  • Graphic design
  • Journalism
  • Music performance
  The training and skills you receive in the Army can prepare you for a civilian career in film production, advertising, or professional music to name a few. You are also able to earn certifications and licensures for civilian jobs. The training and salary you get are only some of the ways the Army strengthens you for tomorrow. The Army also offers:
  • Comprehensive health care (medical and dental)
  • Generous vacation time (30 days annually)
  • Retirement Savings Plan
  • Family services and support groups
  • Special pay for special duties
  • Cash allowances to cover the cost of living
You may also be eligible for:
  • Enlistment bonuses totaling up to $40,000
  • Up to $81,756 for college
  • Up to $65,000 to repay qualifying student loans
  • Up to $4,500 a year tuition assistance while serving

Job Requirements

Requirements for Arts, Media and Music Opportunities:
  • U.S. citizen or permanent resident alien
  • 1734 years old
  • Healthy and in good physical condition
  • In good moral standing
  • High School or equivalent education
  • Enlistment in the U.S. Army

item.title: Superintendent / Construction / Single Family Homes
item.dc:creator: DHL
item.content:encoded:
Job Description

Superintendent / Construction Project Manager - Single Family Homes
Our client, a growing Real Estate Development Company, is currently seeking a Superintendent / Construction Project Manager Single Family Homes in the greater Seattle, WA area. The successful candidate for the Superintendent / Construction Project Manager will have these general responsibilities:
  • Oversee and manage the construction process from start to project completion.
  • Prepare estimates for construction projects to include material costs, labor equipment, subcontractor and overhead costs.
  • Manage Superintendent, subcontractors and employees.
  • Review construction documents.
  • Develop project objectives, policies, procedures and performance standards.
  • Coordinate the design efforts for internal and external consultants.
  • Frequently visit project sites to ensure quality and process.
  • Promote safe and efficient construction sites.
  • Ensure the projects stay within budget and on schedule.
 

Job Requirements

Superintendent / Construction Project Manager - Single Family Homes
Summary of requirements for Superintendent / Construction Project Manager:
  • Bachelors degree inConstruction Management, Engineering or related discipline.Masters degree in Construction Management, Engineering or MBA preferred.
  • 5+ years of construction project management experience for single family housing.
  • Must have knowledge and experience of the residential construction process and equipment, materials and supplies.
  • Prior experience reading and interpreting construction documents and plans.
  • Ability to multi-task and work in a fast pace and team-oriented environment.
  • Self-driven, highly motivated, excellentleadership, communication, interpersonal, organizational, negotiation, decision making, and problem solving skills.
  • Proficient in MS Office Suite to include, MS Word, Outlook, Excel, Project and PowerPoint.
  • Must have a valid drivers license and current auto insurance.
Salary: $90 - $100K plus bonus potential This Company offers anexcellent benefits plan. For immediate consideration, please submit resume ASAP as an attachment in MS Word to call 888-974-0086 for additional information.
